loans.name: Mendsaikhan

texts.en:
Mendsaikhan, 43 years old, lives with her husband and three children in an old house on fenced land in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as an operator at a carpet factory since 2011. Her husband also works at the same factory and he has held the position of assistant overseer for over nine years. Their children all study at university. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Her house has deteriorated over the years and she wants to renovate it before winter. After renovation, her family can live in a comfortable and warm place where they don't need to burn much coal for heating. The burning of coal is considered to be the main cause of air pollution and the reduction of it will contribute to the efforts against air pollution as less pollutants are released into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Shomurod

texts.ru: Шомурод трудолюбивый молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он с детства всегда мечтал поступить в университет и получать высшее образование. Он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Его родители очень рады за него и поддерживают его. Шомурод любит читать книги и в свободное время разгадывает кроссворд. Шомурод должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Shomurod is a hard-working young man.  He is 18 years old, not married and lives with his parents.  Since his childhood he has always dreamed of going to university and receiving a higher education.  This year he successfully completed his secondary education and started university.  His parents are very happy for him and support him.  Shomurod loves to read books and in his free time does the crossword.  Shomurod needs to pay his tuition, but does not have the money.  He is asking for a loan in order to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant business.

Rosalie has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from pre-paid mobile load.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Santa Barbara. Hace 8 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz en su casa donde vende el producto con sus vecinos.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara en la compra de materia  prima al por mayor como ser maíz, leña y cal para elaborar las tortillas. Su meta es poder seguir dándole el estudio a su hija hasta que se gradúe  en la universidad  con los ingresos que genere el negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia is 44 years old, married, and has one daughter.  She lives in the town of Santa Barbara.  Antonia has been making and selling corn tortillas for eight years.  She sells her products to her neighbors from her home.  

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 10,000 HNL and will be used to buy supplies in bulk such as corn, firewood, and lime powder for making tortillas.  Her goal is to continue providing for her daughter’s education so that she can graduate from the university.  This is why she needs to generate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Siguitemasson Group

texts.fr: Les 4 femmes du groupe Siguitemasson  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de fonio, d’huile, du riz et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Mah (première debout à droite  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de plat de fonio (foyo) dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de grain de fonio et d’huile alimentaires chez son fournisseur à Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   20.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Most of the four women of the group "Siguitemasson" are married  in monogamous households, and they average 48 years of age and two children each, all living in the village of Bamanan-Zambougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and kinship and through their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses selling 'fonio' (a kind of millet), oil, rice, and condiments. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Mah (standing first from the right in the photo) is a great vendor of 'fonio' meals (foyo) in and around the village of Bamanan-Zambougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large amount of 'fonio' and cooking oil from suppliers in Konodimini. The cash or credit sales are made to mostly women customers at her home and in Konodimini.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA with this loan. It will be used to meet the needs of her children and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín se gana la vida como asistente de oficina, tiene dos hijos pero no viven con él, de todas maneras, él les brinda una pensión o asistencia económica mensual, necesita crédito para comprar una computadora portatil, ya que le hace falta para ir a trabajar y además la máquina también puede servir para sus hijos el momentos que tengan que hacer alguna tarea o necesiten redactar algún documento. Efrain vive en El Alto pero trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz. Si bien su nivel de educación es superior al de un bachiller, él no tiene licenciatura universitaria por lo que sus posibilidades de ganar mejor sueldo son escasas, por eso necesita que le colaboren a él y a sus hijos
texts.en:
Efrain earns a living as an office assistant.  He has two children, but they do not live with him.  However, he does provide an allowance or monthly financial assistance.  He needs the loan to buy a laptop.  He needs it to go to work, and the machine is also able to help his children when they have homework or need to edit a document.

Efrain lives in El Alto, but he works in the city of La Paz.  His level of education is beyond his high school degree.  He does not have a university degree.  That is why his possibilities of earning a better salary are scarce.  That is why he needs your help for him and his children.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for working in his office.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is a married parent of four children who are in school. 

Helen has a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Helen is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell her general store like soap, milk, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc..

Helen has sustained her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, shampoo, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Erminda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Erminda has been pig fattening for 1 year, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Last year she opened a grocery store and in one year she developed regular customers. Her husband transports goods between cities using his truck. Mongolian winter, known as the most cold and harsh in the world, is coming soon. So Mrs. Tsetsegmaa has decided to build a house on her land before winter. She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. The high quality house is more comfortable and warmer than a Mongolian traditional ger. Last winter the family burned lots of coal for heating. If they were lived in house, the amount of coal burned would have been halved. The burning coal is the main source of air pollution according to the research department of Mongolia.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Ladiriya Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes du groupe Ladiriya  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de tomate, d’oignon, d’huile et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Dada (1ère   femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pâté  et de la friture farine de blé dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de farine de blé et d’huile chez son fournisseur à Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Dada  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   20000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Most of the five women of the group "Ladiriya" are married  in monogamous households, and they average 33 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Bamanan-Zambougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and kinship and through their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses selling tomatoes, onions, oil, and condiments. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Dada (standing first from the left in the photo) is a great vendor of pâté and wheat-flour fritters in and around the village of Bamanan-Zambougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large amount of wheat flour and oil from suppliers in Konodimini. The cash or credit sales are made to mostly women customers at her home and in Konodimini.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA with this loan. It will be used to meet the needs of her children and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Kurbonjon

texts.ru: Курбонджон 53 года. Она хранительница очага своего дома. Курбонджон вдова, так как 15 лет назад умер ее муж. Она имеет 5 детей. Она прожила очень трудный период после смерти мужа. Она начала свой бизнес после смерти мужа, так как она нуждалась в деньгах. Курбонджон начала свой бизнес одной дойной коровой. Постепенно она начала бизнес купле продажей молочных продуктов. Она год за годом постепенно развевала свой бизнес. Сегодня она успешно введет своё дело. Она вырастила своих детей. Она имеет 2 внуков и собирается провести церемонию обрезания. Она, однако, не имеет денег, чтобы провести эту церемонию. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Kurbonjon is 53 years old.  She is the keeper of the hearth of her home.  Kurbonjon is a widow - her husband died 15 years ago.  She has 5 children.  She lived through a very difficult period after the death of her husband.  She started her own business after his death because she needed the money.  Kurbonjon started her business from a single cash cow and gradually began buying and selling dairy products.  Year after year she slowly and steadily grew her business.  Today, she successfully conducts her business.  She raised her children.  She has 2 grandchildren and is planning to conduct a circumcision ceremony for them.  However, she does not have money for the ceremony.  She is asking for a loan of 3500 TJS.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for a circumcision ceremony for her  two grandchildren

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Fotemogoban sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de tomate, d’oignon, d’huile et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle du prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (1ère   femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tomate et d’oignon dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de tomate et d’oignon avec les exploitants à Konodimini en gros. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Salimata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   18000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Most of the four women of the group "Fotemogoban" are married  in polygamous households, and they average 45 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Bamanan-Zambougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and kinship and through their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses selling tomatoes, onions, oil, and condiments. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Salimata (standing first from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of tomatoes and onions in and around the village of Bamanan-Zambougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large amount of tomatoes and onions wholesale from farmers in Konodimini. The cash or credit sales are made to mostly women customers at her home and in Konodimini.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA with this loan. It will be used to meet the needs of her children and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Perly

texts.en:
This is Perly, 27, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Rico with whom she prays to have a child. She and her husband manage their own household. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Perly runs their tricycle transportation business. They have one vehicle that carries up to four passengers within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers come from the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Perly is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for  the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Perly hopes to buy another tricycle. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending and farming vegetables. Ester is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc. at her general store.

Ester has sustained her business through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling oysters.  Judith is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Fassokounawolo  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Fassokounawolo1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  N’gara  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Korotimi (1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village  N’gara. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group "Fassokounawolo 1" are all married in traditional families, and they average 48 years of age and three children each all living in the village of N’gara, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing tools and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Korotimi (sitting first from the left in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of N’gara. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase seeds and manure, and then pay youngsters to weed her field. Sales of her produce are made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan in order to have the income to support the children and, in part, the family too.

loans.use: to purchase tools, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Santji

texts.en:
Santji is a 43-year-old woman who is married to Venasio, a 33-year-old man. From their marriage, they have 3 children: Ronaldo, a 12-year-old Junior High School student; Santania, a 5-year-old who just joined the early childhood education center; and the last one is Adioda, who is 1 year and 8 months old.
 
Santji's husband works as an "ojek man" (motorcycle taxi driver). To help her husband generate money for her family, Santji started a beauty salon in her house a few years ago. However, in 2005, the house and the business burned down. Santji tried her best effort to do any kind of job in order to raise capital to restart the salon business. 

Finally, Santji has been able to restart the beauty salon in her house by using her own capital. As she just started the business last year, the income she has produced is not stable and is only enough to cover her daily household expenditures. She needs additional money to cover her children's school fees. This situation led her to ask for a 4,500,000 IDR individual loan from TLM. The loan will help to pay for her children's school fees and to add more goods such as instant noodles, eggs, candies, shampoo, and snacks to her beauty salon. She hopes that the business will run well and enable her to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and to add more goods such as instant noodles, eggs, candies, shampoo, and snacks to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr: Les 4 femmes du groupe Tiessiri  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de fonio, d’huile, du riz et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Mayama (2ème femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil et une grande quantité  d’huile chez son fournisseur à Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Mayama  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   18000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Most of the four women of the group "Tiessiri" are married  in polygamous households, and they average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in the village of Bamanan-Zambougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and kinship and through their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses selling fonio (a kind of millet), oil, rice, and condiments. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Mayama (standing second from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of galettes in and around the village of Bamanan-Zambougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of millet and a large amount of oil from suppliers in Konodimini. The cash or credit sales are made to mostly women customers at her home and in Konodimini.

She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 francs CFA with this loan. It will be used to meet the needs of her children and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making galettes to sell

loans.name: Institut Musawato Group

texts.fr: Le client Bukama est leader du collectif d’affaire  des enseignants  de « l’institut Musawato»  et  père de 5 enfants qui étudient. Son épouse est aussi enseignante dans une école maternelle (gardienne). Le client vit de son travail et il est confortable de sa carrière, bien que le salaire soit maigre. Le nouveau prêt qu’il bénéficie de l’IMF Hekima, va lui servir  dans son projet d’habitat (achever son chantier) et d’acheter un nouvel équipement de sa maison (chaises, armoire, appareils électroménagers, etc.). Ainsi,elle souhaite renouveler son prêt prochainement et lancer le projet de construction de maison pour ses locataires. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
This client, Bukama, is the leader of the business collective of teachers from the Musawato Institute. He is the father of five children, who are students. His wife is also a teacher at a nursery school. Bukama makes a living from his work and is comfortable with his career, even though the salary is meager.

The new loan he is receiving from the microfinance institution Hekima is going to be used to finish construction on his house and to purchase new furnishings (chairs, armoire, appliances, etc.) for it. Thus, he would like to renew his loan soon and launch house-building plans for his renters. In conclusion, he thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for teachers.

loans.use: to finish building his house and to purchase new furnishings (chairs, armoire, appliances, etc.) for it.

loans.name: Bakhtier

texts.ru: Бахтиёр жизнерадостный молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет. Живет он в маленьком горном посёлке. Бахтиёр женат и  имеет двоих детей. Он занимается выращиванием и откормом коров, баранов и коз, а также убоем скота и продажей мяса. Это его семейный бизнес, который переходит из поколения в поколение. Бахтиёр торгует говяжьим и бараньим мясом на местном рынке. Для этого у него имеется собственная мясная лавка. В продаже также имеются говяжий и бараний жир, внутренний жир. А также полученную от скота шерсть Бахтиёр продает обработчикам кожи. В неделю 2 раза Бахтиёр покупает скот на убой и продает их мясо. У него имеются свои постоянные клиенты, население покупает для потребления, столовые для приготовления пищи и его продажи. Этот бизнес приносит Бахтиёру хорошую прибыль. Но потребности его семьи постоянно увеличиваются, так как его дети растут. И поэтому Бахтиёр хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получать ещё больше прибыли. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки скота. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Bakhtier is a cheerful young man of 29 years of age.  He lives in a small mountain town.  Bakhtier is married and has two children.  He raises and fattens cows, sheep, and goats, and also slaughters cattle and sells meat.  This is his family business that has been passed down from generation to generation.  Bakhtier sells beef and lamb at the local market and for this has his own butcher shop.  Beef and mutton fat is also available for sale.  Bakhtier also sells processed leather derived from the hair of the cattle.  2 times a week Bakhtier purchases cattle for slaughter and sells the meat.  He has regular customers who purchase meat to eat, cook, and sell.  This business provides Bakhtier with a good income, but the needs of his family are constantly increasing as his children grow.  Bakhtier therefore wants to expand his business in order to make a larger profit.  For this he turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase cattle.  He is hoping for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo, tiene 60 años de vida, estudio tercer año de Educación Básica, esta acompañado; su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo tres están con él  y solo la ultima que es hembra estudia 7°- grado en la misma comunidad.

La actividad productiva que desarrolla, consiste en sembrar la tierra y cuidar algunos animalitos, desde que  dejo de estudiar su padre le enseño el trabajo de la agricultura. Antes trabajaba todo el día, hoy solo medio día.

 Por el momento no cuenta con otras fuentes de ingreso, solo las de sus dos hijos que trabajan con él cultivando, para realizar su trabajo tienen que caminar media hora en cada recorrido  

El préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO, es para comprar semilla de plátano, 10 cacos de abono y la preparación de la tierra con el tractor. Pretende, mejorar su calidad de vida; tener mayores posibilidades para ayudar a otros que hoy necesitan, siempre ha estado pensando en los demás , y para sus hijos que la gente los respeta y quisiera ver al un hijo con su titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Medardo is 60 years old. He has a life partner who works as a domestic. They have four children. Only three of them still live with them. The youngest, a daughter, is studying in Grade 7 in their community. Medardo studied until Grade 3. He is a farmer and also raises animals. Hie father taught him about agricultural once he quit school. He used to work all day, now he is only working half the day. Right now he has no other source of income, just him and his two sons working their fields together. They have to walk half an hour to get to the fields.

The loan Medardo has requested of Fundación Campo is to buy banana seed, ten bags of fertilizer and to prepare the fields with a tractor. He hopes to improve his quality of life; be able to help others that are in need. He has always thought about others. He also wants his children to be respected and would like to see one child get a university degree.

loans.use: to buy banana seed, ten bags of fertilizer and to prepare the fields with a tractor.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She is using her loan to buy grocery items and other products for her variety store. Her income from the business is helping with her everyday expenses at home. Her variety store is growing and she is generating a minimum of PHP 4,000 from sales everyday.

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edwin José

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 33 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer año de nivel básico. Su esposa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y a administrar un pequeño foto estudio que han instalado en la casa. Claro es poco los ingresos, por que en la comunidad lo hacen solo cuando hay algún evento relevante. 

Edwin por su parte, desde hace 15 años desempeña las labores agrícolas; aprendió con sus tíos ya que no se crío con sus padres. El lugar en donde trabaja esta a medio kilómetro de su casa.

El préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO, es para comprar seis sacos de abono, para fertilizar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz.  Al poder comprar el fertilizante, él mejorara su calidad de vida, porque tendrá  oportunidad de producir más granos básicos, y el cliente se sentirá satisfecho.

su sueño, es fortalecer el foto estudio y ser un profesional en esa área es algo que siempre ha soñado, con instalar su propia empresa, pero mientras tanto sigue siendo un agricultor con gran experiencia y que además que sus hijos aprendan un oficio para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 33-year-old man. He studied until the third year of high school. His wife does the domestic duties and runs a small photo studio that they have set up in the house. Of course the income is little because in the community they only do something when there is some relevant event. 

For his part, for the past 15 years, Edwin has carried out agricultural work. He learned how with his uncles since he did not grow up with his parents. The place where he works is a half kilometer from his house. 

The loan requested from CAMPO foundation is to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, in order to fertilize 10,500 square meters of corn. When he can buy the fertilizer, he will improve his quality of life, since he will have the opportunity to produce more basic grains, and his customers will be satisfied. 

His dream is to strengthen the photo studio and be a professional in that area, which is something that he has always dreamed (of starting his own business). Meanwhile, he will continue being a farm worker with great experience and so that his children learn a trade so that they are good men.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, to fertilize 10,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Gemma has been in this business for three years. Gemma earns more income from rice retailing.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erna is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Erna has an oyster farming business in the Philippines. Erna requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase raw materials for her oyster farm.

Erna has been in this business for four years. In the future, Erna would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Maria Jineva

texts.en:
Maria Jineva is 36 years old and married with two children.

Maria Jineva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and earns an income from selling gasoline and e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Maria Jineva aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 42 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Narcisa has been farming rice for seven years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and a new fishing boat.

Helen has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Toshbibi

texts.ru: Тошбиби 48-летняя замужняя женщина, живет со своей семьей в районе Кубадиён. Ее муж уже несколько лет работает мигрантом в России. Сама Тошбиби занимается животноводством. Она за счет этой деятельности, а также за счет высланных денег мужа накопила сбережение в размере 1000 таджикских сомони. Тошбиби хочет одновременно начать торговый бизнес. Она решила заняться куплей и продажей миндального ореха. Тошбиби будет закупать миндальный орех с близлежащих сёл по низкой цене и затем продавать на рынке района по прибыльной цене. Тошбиби целеустремленная и усердная женщина. Для реализации цели она запрашивает кредит. Тошбиби хочет таким образом улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Toshbibi is a 48-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Qubadiyon. For several years now, her husband has been working as a migrant worker in Russia. Toshbibi works in animal husbandry. With income from her work as well as with the money her husband sends back, she has accumulated savings of 1,000 TJS. 

Toshbibi wants to start an additional retail business. She has decided to buy and sell almonds. Toshbibi will buy almonds from nearby villages at low prices and sell them at the market for a profitable markup. 

Toshbibi is a focused and hard working woman. To achieve her goal, she is applying for a loan. By doing so, Toshbibi hopes to improve her family's financial well-being.

loans.use: to buy and resell almonds

loans.name: Lety Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Lety vive en una colonia de la ciudad de Danli, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería de diferentes empresas y ropa interior para mujeres como ser bóxer, brasieres, bikini, etc.
Doña Lety los cosméticos y perfumería  los ofrece por catalogo, sale a vender de manera ambulante en los diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad, donde ya tiene clientes que la prefieren y le encargan más de su producto, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos de cremas, lociones, perfumes, glases, polvos, sombras, blúmeres, braseares, etc. ya que tiene encargados y espera así suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña Lety ha sabido ganarse sus clientes por su amabilidad y buen trato, es una persona responsable con deseos de superarse, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, uno de los sueños es tener su propia tienda en el centro de la ciudad y ofrecer gran variedad de  productos ya que sus clientes han aumentado.


 
Danli, Honduras - Agosto 2013
texts.en:
Lety lives in a neighborhood of the city of Danli, with her husband and their 2 children. She works selling cosmetics and perfumes from different companies and under garments for women like boxers, bras, underwear, etc. 

Lety offers the cosmetics and perfumes through a catalog. She goes out to sell in the different neighborhoods and sections of the city, where she already has customers that prefer her and order more products from her. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of cosmetic products: creams, lotions, perfumes, glazes, powders, underwear, bras, etc since they have already been ordered and she hopes to supply the demand of her customers.  

Lety has known how to win her customers with her friendliness and good treatment. She is a responsible person with a desire to move forward. She has the support of her husband. One of her dreams is to have her own store in the center of the city and offer a great variety of products since her customers have increased.

loans.use: to purchase creams, lotions, perfumes, glazes, powders, shadows, under garments, bras, etc for her business.

loans.name: Bendecidas Por El Señor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Bendecidas Por El Señor” está conformada por 09 mujeres entusiastas que se encuentran en el 7mo ciclo. Mariza de 54 años es casada con 01 hija aún dependiente. Hace 03 años que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a la motivación y apoyo de su esposo pudo emprender su propio negocio. Se siente feliz pues de esta manera puede seguir apoyando en su hogar. Solicitó  el crédito para la compra de abarrotes y bebidas. Su siguiente meta es de poner su propio taller de de tejidos, pues tiene conocimiento para ello. El grupo “Bendecidas Por El Señor” agraden a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Mariza se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa celeste y pantalón negro.
texts.en: The “Blessed by the Lord” Communal Savings Group is made up of nine enthusiastic women who are in their seventh loan cycle. Mariza is 54 years old and married with one daughter still living at home. For three years, she has worked selling basic products. Thanks to the motivation and support she receives from her husband, Mariza was able to start her own business. She is happy because she through her work, she can contribute to supporting her household. Mariza is applying for this loan so she can purchase food products and beverages. Her next goal is to open her own textile workshop, an area in which she has experience. The “Blessed by the Lord” group thanks Kiva investors for the help they provide. In the photo, Mariza is seated in the front row, first on the right; she is wearing a light blue top and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase food products and beverages.

loans.name: Otilia Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Otilia es una comerciante que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de baleadas y refrescos naturales, desde hace 5 años, su actividad la lleva a cabo en un reconocido parque de la ciudad, en donde instala una carpa, su estufa, una mesa, coloca los termos que contienen el refresco  y luego comienza con la elaboración de las deliciosas baleadas.
Doña Otilia aprovecha la ubicación estratégica del parque ya que hay gran numero de personas que circulan a diario y en los alrededores hay bastantes talleres de reparación de vehículos por eso tiene una muy buena afluencia de clientes, su amabilidad y jovialidad y su buen trato hacen que sus ganancias aumenten lo cual le permite cumplir con su compromiso. 
Doña Otilia necesita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, huevos, soda, sal, frijoles, mantequilla, queso, moras, maracuyás, etc.  Que son necesarios en la elaboración de sus productos y aprovechar este mes que es donde se celebra el festival del maíz para aumentar sus ventas, uno de sus anhelos es tener su local propio y tener un restaurante, donde además de vender sus ricas baleadas puede ofrecer todo tipo de comida.  


 
Danlí, Honduras - Agosto 2013
texts.en:
Otilia is a businesswoman who has been making and selling baleadas [flour tortillas filled with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat] and natural soft drinks for the past five years. She runs her business from a well-known park in the city, where she sets up a tent with a stove, a table and thermoses of drinks. She then starts making the delicious baleadas.

Otilia says the park is a good location for her business because many people pass by it every day, and there are several car repair shops in the surrounding area.  For this reason she has a very good flow of customers. She believes her profits are increasing because she is kind, cheerful and treats her customers well, and because of this she can meet her obligations. 

Otilia is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make her items such as flour, eggs, baking soda, salt, beans, butter, cheese, blackberries, passion fruit and others. She says she hopes to benefit from the corn festival this month and increase her sales. Otilia says that one of her dreams is to have her own restaurant where she can sell not only her delicious baleadas, but all types of dishes. 

Danlí, Honduras- August 2013

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, baking soda, salt, beans, butter, cheese, blackberries, passion fruit and other ingredients.

loans.name: Francelina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Francelina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like petrol and diesel. She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy petrol, diesel.

loans.name: Fassokounawolo B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Fassokounawolo B sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  N’gara  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Rokia (1ère femme assise à gauche dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Fassokounawolo B group are all married women living in traditional families. On the average, they are 34 years old, with three children. They all live in the N’gara village in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through their seasonal agricultural activities or as relatives or village neighbors. They grow peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy small tools and stock up on agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc], the group members have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso and are now on third agricultural loan cycle.

Mrs. Rokia (the first one seated on the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to pay for the cost of labor on her field as well as seeds and fertilizers and also the cost of weeding, done by young people. At the end of the rainy season, she will sell her produce to repay her loan, with the remaining revenue to be used for her children’s and her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlina works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from general store. Merlina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish for her dried fish making business.

Merlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her dried fish making business.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru: За счет предыдущих кредитов от КИВА  у Сильвии увеличился доход примерно на 1 500 гривен. За счет дополнительной прибыли Сильвия теперь может позволить себе платить за обучение сына в экономическом колледже, куда тот поступил в этом году. На торговой точке у Сильвии увеличился ассортимент товара, стало больше постоянных клиентов. Сильвия планирует использовать сумму в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно осенние блузки, платья и юбки под реализацию этой осенью.
texts.en: Thanks to previous loans from Kiva, Silviya has increased her revenue by about 1,500 hryvnia. With the additional profit she is now able to pay for her son's education at a college of economics, which he enrolled in this year. Silviya has increased the assortment of goods at her shop and now has more regular customers. She plans to use 5,000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal merchandise, specifically fall blouses, dressed and skirts, to sell this autumn.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing items for resale

loans.name: Rossan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rossan works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Rossan is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish for her business buying and selling dried fish.

Rossan has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish for her business

loans.name: Stepan

texts.ru:
Степан – из Виноградово. Он занимается ремонтом автомобилей на дому. У него есть своя мастерская – в гараже дома, работает один. Степан живет с родителями, в их доме. Ему очень нравится заниматься ремонтом машин, этим бизнесом он занимается уже 5 лет. 
Степану понадобилась сумма в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы отремонтировать крышу – заменить шифер. Степан давно хотел починить прохудившуюся крышу, но у него не хватало собственных средств. Он собирается использовать средства КИВА для того, чтобы осуществить этот ремонт своими собственными силами, а деньги использовать на закупку материалов.
texts.en:
Stepan is from Vinogradovo. He is a car mechanic working out of his home. He has his own shop in the garage of the house where he lives. He works by himself. Stepan lives with his parents in their house. He really enjoys repairing cars; he has been in this business for five years.

Stepan needs 8,000 UAH in order to repair the house roof, replacing the roofing slate. He has been planning to repair the worn roofing for some time, but his own means are insufficient. He plans to use his Kiva loan to buy the construction materials and carry out the repairs on his own.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Santa Terecita-32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA TERECITA-32 en esta segunda secuencia está compuesto por ocho integrantes, cinco  mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco sigue siendo la Sra. Erika, cuenta que no le fue tan bien con la anterior actividad que era la venta de ropa, así que se dedica en esta oportunidad  a la Venta de comida, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,   como papa, fideo y arroz por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio ya que con esta actividad le va muy bien.
texts.en: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA TERECITA-32 en esta segunda secuencia está compuesto por ocho integrantes, cinco  mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco sigue siendo la Sra. Erika, cuenta que no le fue tan bien con la anterior actividad que era la venta de ropa, así que se dedica en esta oportunidad  a la Venta de comida, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,   como papa, fideo y arroz por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio ya que con esta actividad le va muy bien.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for prepared food.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene  64 años, es viudo y tiene la satisfacción de haber dado lo mejor a sus hijos  quienes hoy ya son personas independientes. Vive solo en su casa hecha de material noble. Se dedica a la venta de calzados de diversos tipos en su puesto ubicado dentro del mercado de su localidad. Se inició hace más de 30 años convirtiéndose así en uno de los fundadores de este centro comercial.Al quedar viudo se vio en la obligación de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y a base de su trabajo logró brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio recibiendo a clientes que son en su mayoría personas del campo y a quienes vende los diversos calzados tales como zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias y demás prendas de vestir para el uso cotidiano y de trabajo. Tiene el objetivo de mejorar cada día su negocio y a su vez seguir trabajando con la motivación que lo caracteriza. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor para su negocio tales como sandalias y zapatillas de lona.
texts.en:
Mario is 64 years old. He is a widow and takes pride in having given the best to his children who are now living independently. Mario lives by himself in a house made of respectable material. He makes a living selling shoes of various types in his stand located in a neighborhood market. He started the business over 30 years ago, becoming one of the founders of that shopping center. When he became widowed, he was obliged to care for his children's well-being and through his work, he succeeded in providing them a good quality of life.

Mario opens the doors of his business very early in the morning, receiving customers who are mostly people from the country. He sells them many types of shoes such as dress shoes, sneakers, sandals, and other accessories for daily use and for work. His objective is to improve his business every day and to continue working with his characteristic motivation.

This is Mario's third loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he receives to move forward. At this moment he is asking for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy wholesale merchandise for his business, such as sandals and canvas sneakers.

loans.use: to buy sandals and canvas sneakers

loans.name: Tindwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIATA représente le groupe TINDWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 10mois. Personne ne va à l’école. 
Mme vend des œufs  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Gounghin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes,  gérants  de kiosque et boutique.
Elle veut s’acheter 25plaquets d’œufs.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne augmenter  sa clientèle et  mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Safiata represents the Tindwende group. She is married and the mother of two children who are 10 months old and five years old. Neither child goes to school.

Madame has been selling eggs for five years. She gets her supplies in Gounghin. Her clients are men, women, and boutique and kiosk managers. 

She would like to buy 25 cartons of eggs. She would like to save her profits in order to strengthen her business. She would like to grow her customer base and take better care of her family.

loans.use: buy 25 cartons of eggs.

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
Leotina is very thankful for the financial assistance previously given to her. She used her loan in buying biscuits. She also used the loan for the education of her children. As of now, she is also selling doormats and peanuts. She is taking all the opportunities that come her way, just to earn money.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP. She will use part of this loan to buy more biscuits, to expand her inventory. The more items she has on hand to sell, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. She will use another part of the money to buy door mats and peanuts. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leotina is hoping to have a store located inside the mall, and her dream is to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional biscuits, doormats and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
This is Menchie, 53, a resident of Batasan, Quezon CIty, Philippines. She is married to Rudimer, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Menchie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Menchie dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a 'nipa' roofing business in the Philippines.

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy materials needed for her 'nipa' roofing.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams. She hopes to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to weave 'nipa' roofing panels.

loans.name: Pelayo

texts.es: Pelayo tiene 44 años es casado con Urbana y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Inicialmente se dedicaba a la agricultura pero ahora tiene una tienda de comestibles en el mercado de abastos de su localidad. Se inició en este oficio con poca mercadería a manera de prueba  y con un establecimiento sencillo, pero al tener buenas ganancias esta se convirtió en su principal sustento económico. Tiene el agrado de ofrecer a sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son amas de casa y encargados de restaurantes una buena variedad de verduras frescas, así como víveres y cereales de los  mas consumidos logrando obtener una buena ganancia por estos productos. Se siente muy contento por como desarrolla su trabajo ya que su esposa se encarga de atender a los clientes apoyándola en horas punta y trasladando la mercadería a reemplazar logrando así tener un negocio bien organizado. Lleva casi 24 años de experiencia en el rubro y hasta hoy se siente muy motivado esperando cumplir sus objetivos a largo plazo. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de su mercadería al por mayor como arroz, cereales, verduras frescas, sacos de papa, entre otros para mantener su negocio bien abastecido.
texts.en:
Pelayo is 44 years old and married to Urbana. They have three children and live in their own house. Initially, Pelayo made a living in agriculture but now he has a grocery store in the public market where he lives. 

He started his business with little merchandise as a test in a small establishment, but when he achieved good profits he converted it into his principal livelihood. He has the pleasure of offering his customers, mostly housewives and restaurant managers, a wide variety of fresh produce, as well as the provisions and grains that are most commonly consumed. He manages to achieve a good profit through these products. 

He feels very happy with how his business is developing, since his wife is responsible for attending to customers during peak hours and restocking the merchandise, in this manner ensuring a well-organized business. He has almost 24 years of experience in this field and through today he has been very motivated in achieving his long-term goals.

This is his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he receives to move forward. Additionally he promises to make his payments on time. On this occasion, he would like 4,000 nuevos soles to buy wholesale merchandise such as rice, grains, fresh produce, sacks of potatoes, among other things to maintain a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, grains, fresh produce and sacks of potatoes, among others.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIMPRODIOULA, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le pois sucré avec Mme  SALI SIAKA  debout en deuxième position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women averaging 52 years of age, with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Nimprodioula, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso; the prior loans have been duly repaid. The cultivate sweet peas, as is the case of Mrs. Sali Siaka. She is the second one standing from the left in the phooo. With her loan, she plans to pay for the cost of labor, seeds, and fertilizers for 0.5 ha [1.2 acres] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce in her village and in Sikasso to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn an average revenue of 90,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Girasoles”  está conformada por 08 socios que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo a través de  sus negocios. Este es el caso de Alicia de 39 años casada con 06 hijos, 05 de ellos menores de edad. Con los deseos de superarse y mejorar sus  ingresos decide emprender su propio negocio. Alicia cuenta con una bodega hace más de  04 años. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. Seguir implementando su bodega es su mayor deseo. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. El grupo “Los Girasoles” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Alicia se encuentra de pie es la tercera del lado izquierdo, viste casaca ploma y polo negro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Girasoles" (The Sunflower) is made up of eight members who have been improving over time through their businesses. 

This is the case for Alicia, who is 39 years old and married with six children, five of whom are minors. With the goals of overcoming and improving her income, she decided to start her own business. 

Alicia has relied on a grocery store for more than four years. With the fruits of her effort, she is able to continue supporting her family. Continuing to run her store is her biggest wish. 

She will invest the loan she is asking for in the purchase of groceries, drinks and candies. The "Los Girasoles" group is grateful for the loan provided and is committed to continue working well.

Alicia is found standing and is the third on the right side, wearing the jacket and black polo.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks and candies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She manages a vegetable- and fruit-vending business in the Philippines.

Norma is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy more vegetables, fruits and spices to sell. Norma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money for her family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fruits and spices to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a business venture, raising crops to earn a living.
 
Josephine has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC. She used it to improve her farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011, to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements on her house and to ensure that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
This is Carol. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the ingredients needed to make bean curd pudding. She also used the loan to send her children to school. Her income from the business is assisting her family with its everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to purchase the ingredients of bean curd pudding.  Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and support the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carol hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She  meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients of bean curd pudding.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona de 65 años de edad, madre de 6 hijas y un hijo, reside en la comunidad en donde la crecieron sus padres, viene de una familia de 5 hermanos (2 varones y 3 hembras), quienes ya tienen sus propias familias.
Ella por razones de la vida no estudio, pues sus padres le decían que el estudio era el trabajo de la agricultura, así  se creció en ese ambiente en la siembra de maíz, frijoles, maicillo y también en la crianza de cerdos.

Se caso a los 17 años y tuvo de esa relación 6 hijas, quienes ya tienen sus propios hogares, ella vive sola en la comunidad, cerca de su hogar viven 5 hijas, y la mayor de todas vive en Guatemala; su esposo murió hace 25 años aproximadamente, su único hijo varón que ella tuvo, murió en la guerra que sufrió el país en los años 80`s.

Anteriormente ella se fue a Guatemala, pues allá su hija tiene una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde, donde aprendió del oficio, y, también lo realiza en la comunidad, aunque en pequeña escala. También, aprendió la crianza y manejo de los cerdos junto con su hija.

Para adquirir,  los insumos para los cerdos , los pollos y para los cultivos, los hace en la ciudad mas cercana, que esta ha 40 minutos de su casa, para abordar el autobús, tiene que caminar por veredas y llegar a la calle.

Para realizar los trabajos no tiene horario pues hay que estar pendiente en todo momento (crianza de cerdos y engorde de pollos). Para la compra de insumos para la milpa y el cultivo de frijol, lo hace acompañada de una de sus hijas y también para la compra de concentrado para los pollos y cerdos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes para la siembra de 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 3,500 de frijol,  tres cerdos para la crianza y engorde, el resto lo invertirá en varios gastos del hogar.

Con ello pretende asegurar su alimentación y obtener ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella,  sueña con hacer una casa de adobe, ya que su casa actualmente es de bahareque. 

Con el crédito pretende obtener mejores ingresos económicos para ella y ayudar a sus hijas, quienes siempre estan pendientes de ella.
texts.en:
Petrona is 65 years old. She is the mother of 6 daughters and a son. She lives in the community where her parents raised her. She comes from a family of 5 siblings (2 brothers and 3 sisters), who now have their own families. For reasons of life, she did not go to school, since her parents told her that her schooling was work in agriculture. Thus she grew up in this environment, planting corn, beans, and sorghum, and also raising pigs.

She married at the age of 17, and from this relation she had 6 daughters, who now have their own households. She lives alone in the community. Five daughters live near her home, and the oldest lives in Guatemala. Her husband died about 25 years ago. The only son that she had died in the war that the country suffered in the 80s.

She previously went to Guatemala, since there her daughter has a little farm where she fattens chickens, where she learned this work, and she also does this in the community, although on a smaller scale. She also learned to raise and manage pigs together with her daughter.

To acquire the supplies for the pigs, the chickens, and the crops, she goes to the nearest city, which is 40 minutes from her house. To take the bus, she has to walk along paths to arrive at the road.

She doesn't have any fixed schedule to do her work, since she needs to be attentive at every moment (to raise pigs and fatten chickens). When she buys the supplies for the farm and raising beans, as well as when she buys concentrate for the chickens and the pigs, she is accompanied by one of her daughters.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy fertilizers for planting 3500 square meters of corn and another 3500 of beans, and three pigs to raise and fatten. She will invest the rest in various household expenses.

With that she intends to assure her food supply and obtain economic income to improve her quality of life. She dreams of building an adobe house, since her present house is of wattle and daub.

With the loan she intends to obtain better economic income for herself and to help her daughters, who are always attentive to her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to plant 3500 square meters of corn and 3500 of beans and three pigs to raise and fatten, and also to pay some household expenses

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia Gregoria se dedica al negocio de preparacion y venta de picarones (es un postre que se prepara con masa de camote y se acompaña con miel),la socia vende en forma ambulatoria ,la socia trabaja desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender los picarones.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,azucar y aceite y miel.

La socia esta feliz con el credito ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Gregoria has a business of preparing and selling picarones (a dessert that is prepared from a sweet potato dough and is eaten with honey). She sells them as a walking vendor. She works from 4 pm to 10 pm. She has already had this business for 5 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell picarones. She is applying for the loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, and honey.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and honey

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijos y esposa. Su negocio es el servicio de molino desde hace 6 años.
Don Antonio tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación y debido a que es un lugar muy céntrico tiene muchos clientes. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para brindarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino. 
Don Antonio con el préstamo espera que su negocio funcione de la mejor manera y así aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Don Antonio espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y comprarse otro molino, para así poder seguir apoyando a su familia en cualquier problema económico que surja.
.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Señor Antonio is a very hard-working and responsible person. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras, along with his wife and children. His business for six years has been providing milling service.

Don Antonio has his business in the house where he lives, and thanks to the fact that it is a very central location, he has many customers. He needs the loan to buy the tools to provide the necessary maintenance to his mill.

Don Antonio hopes that with the loan his business will function in the best way and thus increase his income, and thanks to this he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family a little bit, with the increase in the household income.

Don Antonio hopes in the short term to make his business grow and to buy another mill, to thus be able to continue helping his family with whatever economic problems arise.
.

Choluteca, Honduras – August,  2013

loans.use: to buy sandpaper, files, oil, belts, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and lives with her eight children. She works in her hog-raising business. She has been in this business for many years. Her parents are farmers and she learned the business from them. Specifically, she fattens the pigs and sells them after 3-4 years.

Her loan will be used to buy an additional piglet and feed. Her dream is to send her son to a university and see him graduate with whatever course he decides.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet and feed.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Lucrecia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucrecia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Lucrecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy the needed products and supplies for her direct selling business. Her income from business is assisting their family's everyday expenses. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better and the more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Luisa dreams that her business will continue to expand and that she will have more sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 64 years old and married.  She works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from boarding house rental. Norma is borrowing 18,000 Philippine Pesos through Kiva's partner NWTF to buy additional herbal medicines to sell for her buy-and-sell herbal medicines business.
