Jayamala has engaged ten workers for the initial processing and weaving of saris. She only produces saris because of the demand in the market. Jayamala gets 15 lengths of sari per day. A bundle of yarn costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees and it produces 80 to 100 saris.She sells her products to the local traders, who come to take the finished product  from her home on a weekly basis. From this business she earns a monthly income of Rs.10,000, which is not sufficient to materialize her future dream. 

With the present loan of 48,000 INR, she wants to buy thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of the raw materials. Jayamala wishes to grow her business and save enough to start a dyeing unit of her own. This will help her to do dyeing as per her wish and also fetch some extra income by dyeing others' yarn. Jayamala also hopes to arrange the marriage of her son and daughter in a respectable way.

The other three members of the group are Ahalja, Gunjamati and Harabati, doing grocery wholesale, cloth weaving and a sweet items making and supply business respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing yarn.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, 56 years old and married, works very hard to provide for her family. For 30 years she has run a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items.


Cecilia has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell such as groceries, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy items such as groceries, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for two years now.


Concordia has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, noodles, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a young entrepreneur of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. He is married with six children. He runs a swine-fattening business while his wife sells food to make a living. 

He recently joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase pigs for his swine-fattening business. He plans to improve his fattening business in order to gain more income and be able to save a portion for the future of his family and his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for his swine-fattening business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, who lives in Maningcol, Ozamiz City with her four children, works as an employee in a private company and at the same time has a transportation business providing motor transportation and rental services. She has been doing this for two years to earn sufficient income to support the needs of her children and the entire family.


Marife has requested a loan of 10,000.00 PHP from Gata Daku MPC for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle. She want to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eleonor is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Eleonor has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Eleonor requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Eleonor has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eleonor would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 38 years old, married and has four children who are in school. 

Elisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elisa requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 54 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Felicitas works very hard to provide for them.

Felicitas runs a buying and selling of nipa (woven palm fronds) roofing material business in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Felicitas has been in this business for 36 years.

In the future, Felicitas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa (woven palm fronds used for roofing) to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Conchita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mirsad

texts.en:
Mirsad is a 26-year-old married father of a daughter and son, ages 1 and 4 years old. Mirsad works repairing and replacing windows and doors and his wife makes handicrafts. Together the money they generate is not enough to support their family and complete the plastering on the house that is needed. For the first time, Mirsad is requesting a loan in order to plaster the rooms of the house. 

This loan will be of great help to him since without it, he would not be able to manage completing these improvements. In the future, Mirsad hopes to improve the living conditions of his family and reach his goal which is to give his family a sustainable future. He and his family are very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To plaster the rooms of the house

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwavita est conseillère d’une association d’affaire  « Makimbilio»,  senior entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 51 ans  et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de poulets. Elle installe ses poulets au marché public et parfois, à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il y a plus de 30 ans. La cliente a déjà réalisé plusieurs micro projets à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce pour sa famille. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 poulets. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise par un projet d’élevage moderne et construire une jolie maison pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Hekima client Mwavita is one of the officers of a business group called  « Makimbilio». She is a  senior entrepreneur with much experience, aged 51 and the mother of 10 children who all attend school. This client sells chickens. She displays her chickens at the public market and sometimes, at her home. She began her business with her own money, received from her husband more than 30 years ago. 

Mwavita has already been able to manage several micro-projects for the benefit of her family with the profit from this business. This new loan will allow her to buy 20 chickens. In this way, she hopes to grow her little business by raising chickens in a modern way and construct a nice house for her children. She would like to thank Hekima sincerely for its support with microloans for small-scale business people who can't apply to a conventional bank.

loans.use: to buy 20 chickens

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with an only child. She resides in Maningcol, Ozamiz City, along with her family. Her husband is a church pastor, while she operates a motorcycle-transportation business to make a living. 

She has just recently joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to be used to pay for motor repair and maintenance costs. She plans to acquire another unit of motorcycle for expansion of her business. She want to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for motor repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline appreciates her previous Kiva loan which enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income, thereby improving her living standards. She is now requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase spare parts and paints for repairing motorcycles.


Roseline thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paints for repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  DANAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur seizième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Ami assise en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce de friperie.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 2 balles de friperie qu’elle revendra en detail au grand marché ainsi qu’à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 34 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of DANAYA Group are women who average 40 years of age and three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in  Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their sixteenth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand.

Mrs. Ami (sitting on the left) is selling secondhand clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of secondhand clothing, that she will retail for cash at the Grand Market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 34'000 (ca US$ 78). One part will be used to repay the loan and interest, the remainder will be put away.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señora Mirna  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas.
Doña Mirna su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de  de maíz, leña y cal que es la materia prima para seguir elaborando sus tortillas.
Doña Mirna espera que esta inversión le ayude a contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual desea que sus ventas aumenten  para poder apoyar a su familia.
Doña Mirna espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia a que tenga una mejor calidad de  vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  2013
texts.en:
Mirna is a hard-working and responsible person who lives together with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. Her business is making tortillas. Mirna's business is well known in her community and the demand for her product is high. She needs the loan to buy corn, wood and lime, which are the raw materials she needs to produce tortillas. Mirna hopes that this investment helps her have the materials she needs to conduct her business and meet the demands of her clients. She also hopes that her sales increase so she can better support her family. Mirna hopes that her business continues to grow so she can continue supporting her family so they can enjoy a higher standard of living.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013.

loans.use: to buy corn,wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant  dans des familles monogamiques au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  KADIA  1 ere de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo fait le commerce de bazin moyen  riche.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 20 mètres  de bazin moyen  riche qu’elle revendra en détail au grand marché ainsi qu’à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of KOTOGNOGONTALA Group are women averaging 39 years of age and three children. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their twelfth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand.

Mrs. Kadia is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She sells medium-rich damask.

She intends to user her loan to buy 20 meters of medium-rich damask, that she will retail for cash at the Grand Market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 32'500 (ca US$ 65). One part will be used to repay the loan and interest, and the other part will be put away.

loans.use: to buy 20 meters of medium-rich damask

loans.name: German

texts.es: German vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en El Alto, se gana la vida como ayudante de cerrajería, lo que gana le sirve para cubrir sus gastos personales y ayudar en el hogar familiar, German quiere superarse en cuanto a estudios se refiere por lo que necesita credito para una computadora pentium 4. German quiere aprovechar que no tiene hijos para dedicar tiempo al estudio, él tiene nivel de secundaria pero eso no es suficiente para él.
texts.en: German lives in his parent's house in El Alto. He makes his living as an assistant locksmith. What he earns pays for his personal expenses and helps support the household expenses. German wants to carry on with his studies and for this reason he needs a loan to buy a Pentium 4 computer. German wants to take advantage of not having children to use the time to study. He has his secondary education but that is not enough for him.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use in his education.

loans.name: Las Pioneras Group

texts.es: Un conjunto de personas responsables y activas  son las integrantes del grupo “Las Pioneras” la cual lo conforman 07 mujeres  que buscan surgir cada día.  Este es el caso de Maribel casada con 02 hijos menores de edad.  A sus 35 años Maribel se siente feliz de haber cumplido  con algunos de sus sueños,  muestra de ello  es que ha mejorado  su vivienda. Actualmente cuanta con una bodega, viene trabajando de esta manera hace más de 03 años, a pesar de la competencia Maribel a logrado fidelizar a sus clientes, pues eso la hace feliz. Con el reciente préstamo  comprará abarrotes, golosinas y así surtir su bodega. Seguir implementar su bodega es su mayor anhelo. El grupo “Las Pioneras” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible esté crédito. Maribel es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca roja.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Pioneras group are responsible and active people.  The group is comprised of seven women who look to rise up each day.  This is the case with Maribel.  She is married and has two minor children.  At her 35 years of age, Maribel is happy to have fulfilled some of her dreams.  An example of this is that she has improved her house.

She currently has a store, and she has been working this way for over three years.  In spite of the competition, Maribel has managed to get loyal customers.  This makes her happy.  She will use the new loan to buy groceries and candy to stock her store.  Her biggest desire is to carry on with her store.

The Las Pioneras group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.  Maribel is the first one on the left, and she is wearing a red jacket.

loans.use: to buy groceries and candy.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a married woman and a mother of two young children; she is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Jenalyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stock and attract more buyers to her store thus increasing her sales and income. 

In the future, Jenalyn hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue for things like food which is necessary for the needs of the family. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena works hard to support her family. Magdalena is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Magdalena requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell.

Magdalena has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Reylyn

texts.en:
Reylyn is 37 years old and married with two children.

Reylyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc..

Reylyn has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loading.

Reylyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que son ya mayores e independientes. Vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia hecha de madera. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que anteriormente poseía una tienda de comestibles, pero al notar que podía dedicarse a una labor mas dinámica optó por la venta de ropa. Lleva casi 18 años en el rubro y hasta el momento ha logrado convertirlo en el principal sustento de su familia. Suele ubicar su puesto en la feria dominical de su distrito esperando la visita de sus compradores a quienes ofrece una buena variedad de prendas para vestir como blusas, polos faldas y demás prendas de buena calidad. Para mantener su negocio bien abastecido suele traer ropa al por mayor desde otras ciudades.
Se siente muy contenta con su trabajo ya que cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposo quien la ayuda a trasladar su mercadería. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor dentro de las cuales están los faldones y faldas para señoras del campo.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 53 years old, married, and has three grown children. She lives with her husband in her own home, which is made of wood. She describes herself as a hard-working person. She used to have a grocery store, but realized that she could have a more active job selling clothing. She says she has almost 18 years in this area, and that her work has become the principal source of income for her family.

Teodosia says she usually sets up her stall in the weekly market that takes place in her town on Sundays. She offers her customers a good variety of clothing items such as blouses, polo shirts, skirts and other high-quality garments. She says she keeps her business well-stocked with clothing that she buys wholesale in other cities. Teodosia says she is very happy with her work and that her husband supports her and helps her transport her merchandise.

This is Teodosia’s first Kiva loan. She says she is thankful for the support to move ahead with her business, and she promises to make her payments on time. She is requesting 2,000 PEN to buy wholesale clothing such as skirts and christening robes for women who live in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as skirts and christening robes.

loans.name: Norma Dilenia

texts.es:
La  joven  Norma  una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable   y seria, vive  y su  hijo en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  achinería  trabajo que realiza desde  hace desde hace más de 3 años.
Norma tiene su negocio ubicado en un mercado de su comunidad, dicha  actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos. El préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de toda clase de ganchos, vinchas, peines, colas, cepillos, peinetas, etc.
Norma con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco su situación  económica y la de su familia.
Norma espera que  a un corto plazo su negocio siga creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en  el  más conocido del  de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto  del   2013
texts.en:
The youthful Norma, an enterprising, honest, responsible, and serious person, lives with her son in a community in the south of Honduras. Her business is buying and selling decorative hair products, something she has done for 3 years now.

Norma's business is located in a market in her community. This activity accounts for the majority of her income. She needs a loan to purchase all types of hair clips, headbands, combs, pig tails, brushes, decorative combs, etc., to sell. 

Norma hopes that her business will grow from increased sales, since she will have more merchandise to offer her customers. And she believes this will improve the economic situation of her family somewhat.

Norma also hopes that in the short term, her business will continue growing and be consolidated, becoming the best known in the zone, thus continuing to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair clips, headbands, pig tails, brushes, and combs for her business.

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario es una persona de 32 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta bachillerato, y hoy en día se dedica a trabajar; él vive con su madre y la señora tiene 82 años de edad,  también vive su compañera de vida y dos hijos, los niños están estudiando. El señor en un tiempo viajó a los estados unidos para trabajar y ganar dinero para mantener a su madre y a su familia. 

El señor trabaja de albañil es su negocio, en la zona donde vive ha construido varias casas, todas las personas del valle lo conocen, él tiene mucha experiencia en la construcción de casas. También en mejorar la estructura de casas que están averiadas; esta experiencia la obtuvo cuando estuvo en los estados unidos desde la edad de 22 años, el comenzó a trabajar en empresas muy conocidas; luego se regresó al El Salvador por motivos de salud de la mamá. Desde entonces, este conocimiento lo ha aplicado en la zona donde vive y ha realizado buenos trabajos.    

El utilizara el dinero para comprar 4 sacos de abono, un galón de quemante para la mala hierba, volatón granulado etc. que utilizara en el mantenimiento del cultivo de maíz 
El préstamo le mejorara su condición de vida, en la obtención de la cosecha al final del ciclo de vida de la planta, en la cual podrá vender y consumir el maíz que cosecho al final de su temporada.

proyecta seguir trabajando con la institución, que le dio la oportunidad de trabajar con el crédito; ya que  los últimos créditos que tubo los ocupo para la siembra del maíz y en otra necesidad que tenía en ese momento.
texts.en:
Mario, age 32, went to school up to high school.  He now works.  He lives with his mother, who is 82 years old.  He also lives with his life partner and two children.  The children go to school.  At one time he traveled to the United States to work and earn money to support his mother and his family.

His business is working as a bricklayer.  He has built several houses in the area where he lives.  All of the people in the valley know him.  He has a lot of experience building houses.  He also improves the structure of houses that are damaged.  He got this experience when he was in the United States.

When he was 22 he started to work for well-known companies.  He then returned to El Salvador because of his mother’s health.  From then on he has applied this knowledge in the area where he lives, and he has done good work.

He will use the money to buy four sacks of fertilizer, a gallon of accelerant for the weeds, and granulated insecticide, etc.  He will use these items for maintenance of his corn crop.  The loan will improve his living conditions.  When he gets the harvest at the end of the plants’ life cycle, he will be able to sell and consume the corn that he harvested at the end of the season.

He plans to continue working with the institution that gave him the opportunity to work with the loan.  He used the previous loans that he had to plant corn and for another need that he had at the time.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer, a gallon of accelerant for the weeds, and granulated insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat is a 28-year-old young customer. She is married and a mother of three beautiful kids. Saltanat is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has six years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Saltanat usually sells her crop to the market vendors in her area. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits is served on every table in the Azerbaijani family and they make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, and that's why her son helps her. 

She needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of the products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she has applied for 1,800 AZN. 

This will be her fifth loan. She has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to allow her to improve the quality of the products.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de 38 años, Es soltero y vive solo en una casa hecha de adobe en calidad de alquiler. Llegó hace más de 15 años desde la sierra central del país con el objetivo de buscar un mejor futuro para salir adelante, fue así que se inicio buscando diversas oportunidades laborales y logró emplearse como jornaleros en distintas parcelas de conocidos realizando distintas actividades orientadas a la producción y venta de cacao orgánico en su localidad. Comenta que optó por esta actividad por la demanda laboral que existe y por las buenas ganancias que percibe por cada campaña, no obstante debe en ocasiones lidiar con factores externos como la lluvia para culminar las tareas que le asignan  puesto que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajar y responsable. Aún independiente tiene diversas necesidades las cuales parten desde contar con una vivienda propia y cubrir gastos básicos. Tiene planeado continuar laborando con toda la motivación necesaria y lograr adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo el cual desea destinarlo a la producción integral de cacao orgánico por ser un producto muy influyente y por las buenas ganancias que brinda. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles y junto a sus ahorros concretar la compra su una vivienda hecha a base de adobe siendo este uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Teofilo, age 38, is single.  He lives alone in a rented adobe house.  He arrived 15 years ago from the central mountain range in the country in order to look for a better future and to get ahead.  That was how he started seeking diverse work opportunities.  He managed to get hired as a day worker on different parcels of land of people that he knows.  He did different jobs in the production and sale of organic cacao in his area.

He says that he decided on this business activity because of the demand for work that exists and for the good income that he gets for each season.  However, on occasion he needs to deal with external factors like the rain in order to complete the jobs that are given to him.  He is known for being very hard-working and responsible.

Even though he is independent, he has diverse needs which range from having his own house and covering basic expenses.  He plans to continue working with all of the motivation needed.  He wants to manage to get his own farm land upon which he hopes to produce organic cacao.  This is because it is a very important crop, and it provides good earnings.

This is his third loan with Kiva.  He is grateful for the financial support that he is getting in order to get ahead.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  This time he wishes to have 3,000 soles.  He hopes to use it, together with his savings, to buy an adobe house because this is one of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy an adobe house.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than 20 years. She helps her husband in tilling and overseeing their farm. This is their source of income.

Josefa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and pay for the labor cost of the farm. With this loan, Josefa will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Josefa hopes for making her business a successful and stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and pay for the labor cost of the farm.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 58 years old and is from Ozamiz City. At the age of 58, she runs a store that supports the needs of her family. Her five children help her in tending the business. 

She enjoys her membership with PMPC and has sought capital for her business. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional cases of softdrinks to sell. She wants to increase her sales through investing in having more inventory.

loans.use: to buy addiitonal cases of softdrinks for her store.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is a 26-year-old, young client. He is married and he has one son. Ruslan is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than five years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profit, in order to support his family. Ruslan’s income from business is 130 AZN. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his son will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,800 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: David Moises

texts.es:
El señor David es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijo y esposa. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas, refrescos y churros desde hace varios años.
Don David vende sus productos en su casa de habitación y lugares cercanos a su municipio. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de churros, refrescos, aguas, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, café, pan, arroz, galletas, etc. para darles una atención de calidad a sus clientes.
Don David con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia debido al  aumento de los ingresos en el hogar, espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que su hijo tenga los estudios necesarios y mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
David is a very hardworking, responsible person living with his wife and son in a community in southern Honduras.  His business for the last several years has been selling snacks, soft-drinks and candy.


David sells his goods at home and in places nearby his town.  He needs the loan to buy snacks, soft-drinks, water, beans, sugar, shortening, coffee, bread, rice, cookies, etc. to provide good customer service.


David hopes his sales will increase with the loan thus improving his and his family’s quality of life thanks to the increase in household income.  He hopes in the short run to make the business grow so that he will be able to continue supporting his family and so his son will have the necessary schooling and better life opportunities


Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Sakir

texts.en:
Sakir is 39 years old and married.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   

He earns a living by breeding milk cows and cattle.   He sells their milk and milk products as well as their meat to local butchers. He has 15 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Sakir usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for five or six months, and resells them for a more profitable price to butchers. Milk and yogurt he sells to neighbors. He earns about 180 AZN a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in such everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt. Milk products are seen as very healthy and are used evey day.  

Because he is his family's only source of income, Sakir  is requesting a loan for 2,000 AZN to buy three cattle and two milk cows. This will be his fourth  loan.  He has good client history, and he plans to use the additional income he earns to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and two milk cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, shirts, etc. for her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 46 años, esta casado con Ernestina y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Desde niño fue muy trabajador y apoyaba  a sus padres en el oficio de la venta de ropas, es así que adquirió los conocimientos necesarios para iniciarse como vendedor independiente desde hace mas de 20 años.  Optó por este oficio ya que se trataba de un negocio familiar y por las buenas ganancias que se suele obtener logrando recuperar el dinero que invierte de alguna u otra manera ya que se trata de un producto no perecible según comenta. Cuenta siempre con el apoyo de su esposa Ernestina y de sus hijos cuando recibe la visita de sus compradores logrando así convertirlo en un negocio familiar. Le agrada participar con su stand de ropa en la feria dominical de su distrito ya que es donde obtiene muy buenas ganancias. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería como son los polos de moda para caballeros, polo para damas y blusas.
texts.en:
Víctor is 46 years old and married to Ernestina. They have three children and live together in their own home. Since he was a boy he has been hard-working, helping his parents sell clothes. He gained the knowledge necessary to strike out as an independent seller more than 20 years ago. He says that he opted for this business as he was familiar with it. And because of the good profits he managed to generate from the money he had invested in it, one way or another, given that it is a non-perishable product. He can always count on the help of his wife Ernestina and his children when he has buyers come to visit, making it a family business. He particularly enjoys selling at the Sunday market in his district as he makes excellent income there.

His is Victor's second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial assistance offered him. He promises to pay his installments on time. This loan is for 2,000 PEN to buy merchandise like popular Men's Polo shirts and woman's Polo shirts and blouses.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothing

loans.name: Krisolito

texts.en:
Krisolito is married and a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in selling coconut wine and vinegar to the people in his area. Coconut wine can be fermented into vinegar. To earn additional income, he also has a motorcycle transport business. 

Krisolito is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more containers for coconut wine and spare parts for his motorcycle, such as wheel tire, nuts, and bolts. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business thus augmenting his income and savings.

loans.use: to purchase containers for coconut wine and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is married and has seven children.  She has a general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling food. 

Cresencia is requesting her second loan through NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 38 years old and married with five children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling sand and gravel in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional truck load of sand and gravel to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling sand and gravel for 14 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Nenita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional truck load of sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio es un hombre muy trabajador, el cuenta con la edad de 41 años y le apasiona mucho su trabajo. Desde hace mas de tres años, el Sr. Sergio es supervisor en una gasolinera muy reconocida en la localidad. Los clientes de la gasolineria siempre buscan que los atienda el Sr. Sergio ya que les brinda muy buen servicio. A pesar de ser un hombre dedicado a su trabajo, tambien el es dedicado a su familia y teme por su seguridad ya que en su vivienda esta muy deteriorado el cableado de electricidad y por eso necesita ayuda por medio de kiva para poder realizar la reinstalacion en su vivienda de cablaeado para la energia electrica.
texts.en:
Sergio’s a very hardworking man.  He’s 41-years-old and is passionate about his work.  For more than three years he’s been the supervisor at a very well-known local gasoline station.  The customers at the gasoline station always ask for Sergio to take care of them because of the good service he provides.

Though dedicated to his work, he’s also devoted to his family and is concerned about their safety because the electrical wiring at home is quite deteriorated and this is why he needs Kiva’s help to be able to install new electric wiring at home.

loans.use: to rewire his house.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: Xiomara tiene 36 años, esta casada con José y tienen 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Xiomara cuenta con una farmacia, tiene 9 años en este rubro y gracias a sus proveedores confiables logra obtener medicinas para su pequeño negocio en beneficio de la población. Ofrece a su distinguida clientela diversa variedad de medicamentos tanto de marca y genéricos con los precios mas accesibles ya que entre sus clientes suelen tener a personas de bajos recursos económicos. Asimismo brindan servicio de inyectables, nutrición y demás atenciones correspondientes. Su objetivo a largo plazo apunta a la ampliación su negocio convirtiéndolo en un gran centro de salud que tenga a su vez un área social en beneficio de la población más humilde de su localidad. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,500 nuevos soles y realizar la compra de medicamentos al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara, 36, is married to José and they have three children living with them in their house.  Xiomara has had a pharmacy for nine years and thanks to her trustworthy suppliers she manages to obtain medicine for her small business to benefit the population.  She offers her distinguished clientele a wide variety of medicine, both brand name and generic, at the most affordable prices since among her customers are people of low economic resources.

She also provides injection and nutrition services and other suitable attention.  Her long-term objective is aimed at expanding the business turning it into a large health center that includes social services for the most humble members of the local population.

This is her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion, she’d like 3,500 new soles to buy medicine at wholesale for her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 32 years old and a married man. He has three kids. Yurik is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He raises sheep and sells them for meat. Yurik has been doing this business for 10 years and is a very hardworking person. He puts a lot of effort in this activity because he wants to support his family without lacking financially.

Yurik is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar where butchers and customers purchase this. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc. 

He has taken loans and has a good loan history. This is going to be his sixth loan. This time he requires 1,800 AZN to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in autumn. Yurik is optimistic about this loan because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and there are increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in autumn

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La socia Griselda continua dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada ,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para la construcción de su casa. 

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Griselda continues to work for the private company where she has worked for many years. She says she does well because of the effort she puts into her work every day. She describes herself as a responsible and hard-working person, and she says this is how she helps her family to get ahead. 

Griselda is requesting this loan to build a house. She says she is grateful for the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 46 years old and married, with five children. She has her own store that sells variety of goods. 

She's been a member of PMPC since 2012 and remains a member in good standing. Today, she applied for a loan to replace her supply of store items to sell. 

She hopes to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to replace her supply of store items to sell

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana earns a living through her vegetable gardening business in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 15 years now. Mariana helps her husband in cultivating their small farm.

Mariana is asking for a loan to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their vegetable farm, thus augmenting their yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KSH 15,000 to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel is 29 years old with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Jocel has been in this business for three years.

In the future Jocel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Yulduzoy

texts.ru: Юлдузой добросовестная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж занимается скотоводством. Она трудолюбивая женщина и всегда старается помогать своему мужу по обеспечению семьи. Она более 27 лет занимается шитьем женской и детской одежды. Она также шьет чехлы для автомашин. Юлдузой хочет расширить свой оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Ее дети Малика, Абдучамил, Нишонгул, Нигина, Зухал ещн не имеют нормального источника дохода, чтобы помочь родителям. Юлдузой запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Yulduzoy is a conscientious woman. She is 45 years old. She is married and raising five children. Her husband works with livestock breeding. She is a hardworking woman and always tries to help her husband with supporting the family. For more than 27 years she has worked with sewing women's and children's clothing. She also sews car covers. 

Yulduzoy wants to increase her working capital and in this way increase her income. Her children, Malika, Abduchamil, Nishongul, Nigina and Zuhal, still don't have a normal income to help their parents. Yulduzoy requests a loan in the amount of 7,000 somoni to purchase fabric. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to increase her working capital

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  SOUTOURA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  MARIAM assise en première position de la  droite vers la  gauche sur la photo fait le commerce de bois de chauffe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt un chargement de 10 tonnes en bois de chauffe qu’elle revendra en détail à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Soutoura Group are married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of three children. They are living mostly in monogamous families in the Hamdallaye district of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their twelfth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of meeting the needs of their customers.

Mariam, shown sitting on the far right in the photo, is a merchant of firewood. With her loan, she intends to buy a load of ten tons of firewood. She plans to resell it at retail for cash from her home to a clientele composed of men and women.

Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 Francs CFA, a portion of which is used to repay her loan and its interest, and the remainder will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Al-Faiha Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al-Faiha, consists of four members who are all females. They are from Aden, Yemen.  All the group members are considered hard-working people who very much want to get ahead.

This group took a loan of YER 170,000.  One of the members, Aswan, is 48 years old and married, with children. She says that she’s very happy because her business has improved little by little. 

She distributes phones and mobile recharge cards. She started the business because she wanted to help her family with her children’s expenses and to have her own capital to cover any unexpected costs. 

She loves her work and aspires to continue. For this reason, she’s asking for a loan of YER 60,000 from AMB to continue buying mobile recharge cards and phones.  They will help her to get more profit from her business.

loans.use: to continue buying mobile recharge cards and phones that will help her increase her profit from her business

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has 10 children. Olympia has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 15 years now. She helps him in tilling their farm.

Olympia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Olympia dreams of expanding their farm so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jesus Fidel

texts.es:
Jesus es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y para poder salir adelante trabaja en un institución como empleado, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, Jesus cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable  y responsable.

Jesus está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar  enseres para su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida, así el seguirá trabajando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Jesús, 21, is a young man living in the city of Ica.  To get ahead he works as an employee in an institution working about nine hours daily.  Jesús believes he does well at work because he’s very kind and responsible.

Jesús is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to buy home appliances thus improving his quality of life and continue working to make his great dream reality: to study a university career.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Meyizgul

texts.ru: Мейизгул 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. У Мейизгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мейизгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 45 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мейизгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мейизгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадьбы сыновей.
texts.en:
Meyizgul is 41 years old, married and raising seven children together with her husband. Meyizgul has secondary education. As the main income for her family, she works with livestock breeding, after having started this business 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Meyizgul's persistent work, she currently has two dairy cows, two horses and 45 sheep on her farm. The monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Meyizgul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows for increasing the number of livestock. Meyizgul plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for her sons' weddings.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Amanda Candelaria

texts.es:
Amanda es una mujer de 55 años de edad, la cual se gana la vida trabajando como empleada en una pequeña institución de su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo. Amanda cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de trabajar.

Amanda está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una cocina a Gas, ya que actualmente tiene una cocina a kerosene, la cual se encuentra en mal estado. De esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su sueño de “Tener un local propio”.
texts.en:
Amanda’s a 55-year-old woman who earns her living working as an employee at a small institution in her city.  With much effort she’s able to cover her household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  Amanda believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very responsible and has a strong drive to work.

Amanda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided she will be able to buy a gas stove since her current one is kerosene and it’s in poor condition.  In this way, her quality of life will improve and she will continue striving towards reaching her dream of having a place of her own.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru: Нозанин 37 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Нозанин после окончания средней школы по семейному состоянию не смогла поступить в университет. Она окончила коротко срочный курс. Она несколько лет работала в библиотеке, и данное время работает в государственной организации. Она хочет получить высшее образование и развеваться по карьерной лестнице. Она в этом году поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Она  должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nozanin is 37 years old. She is married and raising three children. The children are not yet adults. Nozanin was not able to start university after finishing high school, due to family circumstances. She graduated from a short-term course. She worked some years at a library, and currently she works in a government organization. 

Nozanin would like to get higher education and develop her career. This year she entered the Tajik State University of Commerce. She needs to pay her tuition, but does not have the money. She requests a loan to pay for the tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for education at the university

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 42 years old and married, with three children, all in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Loreta runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Loreta has been in this business for three years.  In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Sinignessigui I Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   SINIGNESSIGUI I sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Niaradougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, et  SEYDOU debout au milieu sur la photo,  il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignessigui I Group are married men with an average age of 45 years and an average of five children. They are all living in traditional families in Niaradougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fourth loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Seydou, shown standing in the center in the photo, grows crops of corn. With his loan, he intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, his produce is sold at the village in Sikasso to a clientele composed mainly of retailers coming from big cities.

Seydou expects to earn an average income of 200,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow him to repay his loan and also to help the family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es: Elvia, tiene 31 años de edad, vive  en unión libre con su esposo  con quien  tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Hace 10 años se dedica a  la venta de mercadería como ropa, calzado y cosméticos. El préstamo  que solicito es por 6000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de mercadería como cosméticos, ropa y calzado. Este préstamo le ayudara a poder surtir el negocio  y tener mejores ingresos y complacer a los clientes. Su objetivo es hacer una vivienda ya que vive en la casa de una hermana.
texts.en:
Elvia, 31, lives in a common law relationship with her husband; they have three children and she lives in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.  She’s been selling merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics for ten years.

She’s requesting a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy merchandise like cosmetics, clothes and shoes.  This loan will help her stock the business and to earn higher income and to please her customers.  Her objective is to build a house since the one she lives in belongs to her sister.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una joven soltera de 26 años de edad, vive junto a su madre de 66 años de edad quien se dedica a tejer en el Caserío Xolbé, Cantón El Tablón Sololá, Sololá.
Ella actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de abarrotes en el lugar de su vivienda y en el mercado local de Sololá los días viernes. Cuenta que inicio esta actividad hace 1 año porque le gusta ya que puede cubrir las  diferentes necesidades de sus clientes. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Ella también se dedica a la elaboración de blusas típicas en sus tiempos libres ya que desea sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella  ha visto que las ventas se han mantenido ahora por la temporada del año la demanda en algunos productos aumentan es por eso ella quiere invertir para poder incrementar sus ganancias por ello solicita un  préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para comprar más  productos y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes,  de este modo ella puede brindarles un  mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias para mantener a su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y ampliar su negocio para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 26, is a young single woman living in Caserío Xolbé, El Tablón Canton, Solalá, Solalá, with her 66-year-old mother who is a weaver.

She currently works buying and selling grocery items at home and in the local Solalá Friday market.  She relates that she started this activity a year ago because she likes it because she’s able to meet various customer needs.  By means of what she does she earns income and acceptable profits that help her cover family expenses.  She also works manufacturing traditional blouses in her free time because she wants to move her family forward.

She’s noted that sales have been steady. Now, due to the season demand of some products increases which is why she wants to invest in order to increase profits.  This is why she’s asking for a 2,000 Quetzal loan to buy more products and expand her grocery store.  In this way she’ll be able to provide better customer service and earn higher profits to support her family.  Her dream is to improve the living conditions at home and to expand the business to provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   SINIGNESSIGUI II sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Niaradougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, et  DIAKALIA debout au milieu sur la photo,  il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 205.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignessigui II Group are married men with an average age of 45 years and an average of five children. They are all living in traditional families in Niaradougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fourth loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Diakalia, shown standing in the center in the photo, grows crops of corn. With his loan, he intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, his produce is sold at the village in Sikasso to a clientele composed mainly of retailers coming from big cities.

Diakalia expects to earn an average income of 205,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow him to repay his loan and also to help the family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en: Lerma is married and has two children.  Her husband helps her run her general store.  Lerma is requesting a loan from PMPC for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza resides in Maningcol, Ozamiz City along with her family. She is married with three children. Her husband worked as an office clerk in a private company, while she runs a general store to make a living. 

She has just joined Gata Daku MPC, and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase goods like canned and sachet (smaller-sized) products to sell.

She plans to use the generated revenue as additional capital to expand her business. She wants to gain more income to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods like canned and sachet products (smaller sizes) to sell

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Sagrado Corazón” está constituida por 06  mujeres que llevan trabajando más 01 año. Betty de 48 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Hace más de 05 años que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, decidió emprender este negocio gracias a una  amiga la cual  la motivó. Con su trabajo y esfuerzo Betty ha logrado construir parte de su casa.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de colonias, cremas, talcos y bisutería. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo “Sagrado Corazón” están contentos y agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Betty es la tercera del lado derecho, viste polo celeste y chaleco negro.
texts.en:
The “Sagrado Corazón” (Sacred Heart) communal bank consists of six women who have been working for more than a year.  Betty, 48, is married with two children.  For more than five years she’s been selling beauty products.  She decided to go into this business thanks to a friend who encouraged her to do so.  With her work and effort Betty’s managed to build part of her house.

She will use her latest loan to buy cologne, cream, talc and costume jewelry.  Her next goal is to finish building her house.  Betty is third on the right wearing a light blue shirt and a black vest.  The “Sagrado Corazón group is happy and grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy cologne, cream, talc and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es: Juana es una joven responsable y dedicada a su hogar quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, ya que es muy amable y respetuosa, ella vive junto a su familia quienes trabajan duro para salir adelante. Desde ya hace varios años que no ha podido realizar ningún tipo de mantenimiento a su hogar, razón por la que Juana solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el que pueda comprar cuatro docenas de lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y tornillos para reparar el techo de su hogar y resguardarse mejor de la lluvia. De este modo Juana podrá reparar gran parte del techo dañado que en la actualidad es de teja muy vieja.
texts.en:
Juana is a responsible young woman devoted to her home; she has many good personal references because she’s a kind, respectful woman.  She lives with her family who work hard to get ahead.  

For several years now she’s been unable to do any home maintenance which is why Juana is asking Fusai for a loan to be able to buy four dozen galvanized metal sheets, lumber, nails and screws to repair the roof at home to be better protected from the rain.  In this way, Juana will be able to repair a large part of the damaged roof which is currently made of very old roofing tiles.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets to repair the roof.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business, and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.40,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carmelita works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Carmelita is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. Carmelita has sustained her business activities through her ten previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She prepares and sells various foods such as beans, rice, flat bread, and tea.

She is asking for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour, and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food and flour tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Mina Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mina and it consists of four members. They are all female and live in Aden, Yemen. The members of this group work in different businesses in order to improve their living conditions. They have taken out a loan of 180,000 YER. 

Mina is the leader of group. She is 33 years old and married and has four children. Mina has been selling different things as a business for four years.  She puts forth a lot of effort to increase her profit so that she can apply it to her family's needs. She has applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy goods for her business, such as clothes, perfume and incense. She hopes to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business, such as clothes, perfume and incense

loans.name: Lisbon Group

texts.en:
Salumu, who has been a decorator for four years now, is married with a baby who is still young. He is working hard to enable his family meet all their necessary, basic needs. He works from 7.00 am to mid-night whenever there is a function like a wedding, party, etc.  He has been able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salumu's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more and better rolls of material, better decorative lights, and good flowers. He has repaid all his loans successfully, and he used the profit to buy a plot of land, built a one-room house, and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more stock of bigger and better rolls of new materials and decorating lights. 

He dreams of building his own house.

Salumu will share this loan with his loan group, "LISBON", with six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy more stock of bigger and better new rolls of materials and decorating lights.

loans.name: Sergio Mario

texts.es: Sergio Mario de 48 años de edad casado con un hijo mayor de edad reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, es propietario de una unidad de acarreo comercial en el sector de uno de los mercados del departamento, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, comenzó este negocio hace 14 años con dinero propio, los ingresos familiares dependen de su trabajo de acarreo, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar y lograr una estabilidad económica en su familia, actualmente el solicita crédito para mejoras de su unidad de acarreo comercial como: enllantar, pintura, entre otros, y asi prestar mejores condiciones a su clientela y brindar un mejor servicio.-
texts.en: Sergio Mario, 48, is married with an adult son.  He lives in Chinandega Department in the west of the country.  He owns a commercial hauling truck in one of the departmental markets.  He has regular and occasional customers.  He started the business 14 years ago with his own money.  Family income depends on his hauling services.  One of his dreams is to be able to improve and attain economic stability for his family.  He’s asking for the loan now to repair his commercial hauling services truck, to replace tires, paint, etc. to provide better conditions for his customers and to provide better service.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rewire his house.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina es una persona muy dedicada al bienestar de su casa, ella vive junto a su esposo y trabaja como costurera y también realiza bolsas de tela para vender. Evangelina solicita un préstamo para poder contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de láminas galvanizadas y madera, con esto ella podrá cambiar el techo actual, el cual está muy dañado por las inclemencias del tiempo. De este modo Evangelina y su esposo contarán con una casa en mejores condiciones en donde podrán vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Evangelina’s a person who is very dedicated to her home’s well-being.   She lives with her husband and works as a seamstress; she also makes cloth tote bags to sell.

Evangelina’s asking for a loan to be able to have the money needed to buy galvanized metal sheets and lumber to replace her roof which is quite damaged by the severe weather.  In this way, Evangelina and her husband will have a house in better condition where they can live in more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy supplies to replace the roof.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
This is Irma. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 22,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Irma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes for a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise/products needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has 4 children. 

Teresa has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 7 years now. She helps him in tilling their farm.

Teresa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay the labor costs of the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Teresa dreams of expanding their farm so that it will generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay the labor costs of the farm

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina. She previously obtained a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 PHP loan to buy more parts and cover new maintenance costs of her computer shop. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelina dreams of having her business in a commercialized place, and she hopes to have a tight family bonding. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  There she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Kimsan
