texts.ru: Кимсан 52 года. Вдова, одна воспитывает 4 детей. В 1993 году, Кимсан начала бизнес в торговле фруктами и овощами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Кимсан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Кимсан смогла начать постройку большого дома для своей семьи. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Кимсан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Кимсан планирует вложить в завершение стройки и накопить деньги на приданное своим дочерям.
texts.en:
Kimsan is 52 years old. She is a widow, raising four children alone. In 1993, Kimsan started her business of selling fruit and vegetables, using a sum of 15,000 som (KGS) as starting capital. After being able to develop her business and finding returning customers, Kimsan has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to persistent work with the business, Kimsan was able to start building a large house for her family. With an aim to further develop her expand her business, Kimsan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her turnover. Kimsan plans to invest the income from the loan to complete the building and to save money for dowry for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like red onions, garlic, and vegetables. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy red onions, garlic, and vegetables

loans.name: Sinignessigui Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   SINIGNESSIGUI III  sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Niaradougou, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, et  ADAMA assis en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignessigui III group are married men averaging 45 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in Niaradogou, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to  successfully manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, having duly repaid their prior loans.

They grow corn, which is the case of Adama, for example. He is the first one seated from the left in the photo. He plans to use this loan to pay for agricultural inputs [fertilizers, etc] , seeds and the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres]. After harvesting, he sells his produce in the village and in Sikasso, to a mixed customer base consisting mainly of resellers coming from big cities. He plans to earn an average revenue of 100,000 West African francs per agricultural campaign. This revenue will allow him to pay off his loan and also help with everyday expenses for his large family.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Violetas” está constituida por 06 socios cada uno de ellos con distintas actividades de comercio. Teresa tiene 47 años, separada con 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a la venta de golosinas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Este negocio le ha permitido a Teresa  solvertar con algunos gastos de su  hogar. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, la cual comprará golosinas como galletas, caramelos, chocolates y bebidas. El deseo de Teresa es de poner  un kiosco y de esta forma no tener que hacerlo ambulatoriamente. El grupo “Las Violetas” está agradecido con el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso. Teresa se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo blanco y casaca fucsia.
texts.en: The communal bank “Las Violetas” is made up of 6 members, each one of them with a different job. Teresa is 47 years old. She is separated, with three children, two of whom are still dependents. For twelve years she has worked in candy sales, working as a mobile vendor. This business has allowed Teresa to take care of some of her household expenses. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan, to keep investing in her business. She will use it to buy sweets such as cookies, candies, chocolates, and drinks. Teresa’s desire is to set up a stand, and in this way not have to be a mobile vendor. The “Las Violetas” group is thankful for the loan that was given, because it has made their progress possible. Teresa is pictured seated on the left, wearing a white shirt and fuchsia jacket.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candies, chocolates, and drinks.

loans.name: Eva Isabel

texts.es: Eva, es un persona muy responsable que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales. Ella vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos menores de edad. Con el deseo de ver por el bienestar y seguridad de su familia, Eva solicita un préstamo  a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar láminas y así poder cambiar las actuales que se encuentran picadas, estas las colocará al costado de su casa y así podrán darle mejor soporte a la estructura para que sea más fuerte.
texts.en: Eva is a very responsible person who has very good personal references.  She lives with her husband and three minor children.  Wanting to see to her family’s well-being and security, Eva’s asking FUSAI for a loan to be able to have the money needed to buy sheeting to replace her current ones that are rusted.  She will install them along the sides of the house to provide better support to the structure so that it will be stronger.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan vive junto a su compañera de vida y junto a dos hijos de cuatro y dos años de edad. Juan es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora quien desea tener su casa en mejores condiciones. Juan solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: postes de cementos, láminas, arena y polines y de este modo construir una pequeña galera la cual le permita tener un espacio para bodega. Este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de poder construir este espacio adicional a su vivienda, lo cual había sido muy difícil antes de poder obtener el préstamo gracias a FUSAI.
texts.en: Juan lives with his life companion and their two children who are 4 and 2 years of age.  Juan’s a very responsible, hardworking person who wants to have a house in better condition.  Juan’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy building supplies like cement posts, metal sheeting, sand and roofing purlins to build a small shed to use as a warehouse.  This loan will give him the opportunity of building additional space for his house which had been very difficult to do before being able to get a loan thanks to FUSAI.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is married and has four children.  She is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol.  Zosima has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 15 years.  She helps in tilling their farm. To earn additional income, her husband works as a carpenter.

Zosima is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor costs of the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus augmenting their yield and income. In the future, Zosima dreams of expanding their farm so that it will generate more revenue. She wants to save money to pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Rosie has been in the farming business for more than ten years. 

Rosie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay the labor cost of the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. 

In the future, Rosie dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay the labor cost of the farm

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
This is Lida. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lida dreams to be successful in life and in business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman who lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a tailoring business making garments for both men and women and also curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 15,000 KES,  she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost this business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is married and has four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Mealii wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Erai

texts.en:
This is Erai from Liberia. She is 38 years old and has six children aged between 6 and 22. They live in Logan Town Area, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well known

Erai is married to a man who works at Free-port. Their children are presently in school. Erai finished 12th grade before starting this business 10 years ago. She sells cosmetics and used clothes. She started her business with money from her husband and learned the business from her friends.

She likes her business because she gets small profits from it. She is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics and used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nyemadi

texts.en: Nyemadi lives in New Kru town. She is 47 years old. She is married and has four children between 26 to 16 years old, only two of whom are in school and live at home. She did not attend school so she decided to keep herself busy with business by selling food stuff like milk, sugar, eggs, bread, etc. to improve their lives. She started this business with a little money from her husband two years ago. She said fewer goods on her table is the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said she is proud of her business because it is the only means she has to be able to help the children. She said with the loan she is going to buy more milk, sugar, eggs, bread, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more milk, sugar, eggs, bread, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Gamai

texts.en:
Gamai is 44 years old and lives in Long Town with her husband and three children ages 8, 15, and 24. Only two of her children are in school and one is living on her own. 

She and her husband have been running a shop where they sell charcoal by the bag to make ends meet. She says that with her business, they are able to send their children to school. She says they started this business with money from her oldest child.  

Gamai is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and in the future, to see her children attending college.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es madre de dos hijos por quienes trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante y contar con todo lo necesario. Ella solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder terminar de construir su casa, ya que cuenta con un pequeño terreno en donde inició la construcción pero por falta de ingresos no había podido culminar. Gracias a este préstamo ella podrá comprar: láminas, ladrillos, cemento, arena y todo lo necesario para poder contar con su casa propia y vivir mejor junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marleny is the mother of two children. She works very hard for them in order to be able to get by and take care of everything they need. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to be able to finish building her house. She has a small plot of land where she began construction, but due to a lack of income she hasn’t been able to finish. Thanks to this loan she will be able to buy sheets of metal, bricks, cement, sand, and everything needed to be able to have her own house and live better with her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish her house.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 40 years old and married with one child. Marife works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, candies, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.  Marife has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Marife would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, candies, eggs, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and 50 years old. She supports a family of five. She earns her daily income by selling cereals, and earning a monthly income of  KES 8,000.

She is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase more cereals such as dry maize and beans for resale.The profits she earns will be used to plough back and expand the business.  

Her dream is to continually make profit from her business as she grows and becomes successful.

loans.use: to purchase dry beans and maize for her cereal business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, 41, lives in the farming region of Chibombo District with her six children.  She has been running a small vegetable farm while also managing a grocery shop.  Doris is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can buy a water pump to help irrigate and expand her small farm.

Using buckets, Doris has been drawing water from a nearby well to water her fields of green maize and onions.  Over the past two years she has been selling her produce to markets in the nearby cities of Kabwe and Lusaka.  While she wants to expand her farm further, she currently lacks a water pump.

Water pumps can be a major boost for small farmers such as Doris.  A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive.  Once she secures a loan, Doris will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a water pump Doris hopes to significantly expand her farm, while still having time to manage her small shop.  She hopes to use the new profits from her farm to improve her shop while also support her children in school.  It is for this reason that Doris is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with a loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over five years, she has sold materials such as makuti (palm leaves) used for thatching roofs. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition from other makuti sellers. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Kadzo wants to purchase makuti (palm leaves) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase makuti (palm leaves) for resale.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel, 31, is a farmer and mother of three children from Kabwe District, Zambia.  She has been growing and selling vegetables for the past three years.  Ethel is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can buy a water pump to help irrigate and expand her small farm.

Ethel currently carries buckets of water from a nearby swamp to water her crops.  She is growing tomatoes, greens, okra and winter maize and has dreams of growing more, but currently lacks a water pump to manage a larger field. 

Water pumps can be a major boost for small farmers such as Ethel.  A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive.  Once she secures a loan, Ethel will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Ethel plans to sell her new crops to a larger market in Kabwe where she can fetch a better price.  With the new profits, Ethel plans to support her children in school.  It is for this reason Ethel is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with a loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una señora muy trabajadora y dedicada a su casa, ella se dedica a vender tostadas de yuca y plátano y así mismo fresco de horchata. Mercedes es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar ladrillo, acero, arena y cemento para poder construir un muro perimetral, debido a que actualmente no tiene uno y la división entre su casa y las de los costado es de alambre. Con esto ella podrá contar con una casa más resguardada de su entorno en donde goce de mayor privacidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Mercedes is a hardworking woman, very dedicated to her home. She works selling yucca and plantain tostadas, as well as horchata (a refreshing drink). Mercedes is a single woman, and doesn't have children. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy bricks, steel, sand, and cement. This is to be able to build a wall around her property, due to the fact that currently she doesn’t have one, and there is only wire between her house and those to the side. With this loan, she will be able to have a house that is more sheltered from the surroundings where she can enjoy more privacy at home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, steel, sand, and cement to build a wall.

loans.name: Asatu

texts.en:
Asatu lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals, fewer bathrooms,  filthy conditions,  and over-population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia,  and food is less expensive. 
 
35-year-old Asatu is married, and her husband works as driver at his office. They have three children whose ages are between 2 and 16; only two of her children are currently attending school and they all live at home.

 Asatu was unfortunate not to attend school, but she is busy running her shop which sells peppers, oil, beans, peanuts, etc in the local market. With the loan proceeds she will buy more peppers, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business. She said, "Besides few goods on my table market, I have no other problem for now." With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business fifteen years ago, and learned by seeing other businesswomen. She stated, "I enjoy the flow of customers and the fast buying.  My dreams are to move from food market business to store business, and live a better life in future."

loans.use: to buy more peppers, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kombo

texts.en:
Kombo lives in the Mariakani area near Mombasa Kenya. He is grateful that he was able to get a first loan from Kiva, which he repaid without challenges. He knew about Milango through friends, and he decided to join so that he could access credit to fund his business. 

He runs a food café in his neighborhood, and the business has been doing well. The major challenge that he encounters in his business is customers not paying in good time. He has a vision of opening a restaurant in the next five years.  

He seeks a loan to buy ten sacks of potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for the business. The extra income that he will raise will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in the Kongowea area of Kenya. He is 31 years old and married with three children. He has been running a café for the last year, and the business has been doing great. He is also a plumber and has employed someone to run the café on his behalf. 

Kennedy has a vision that his business will grow  into a reputable restaurant in town. The challenges in the business are transportation costs, competition and finances. 

He learned of Milango Financial Services through friends and is now seeking a loan to buy utensils for the business, such as plates, cups and cutlery. The extra income will increase his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy utensils, such as plates, cups and cutlery

loans.name: Javier Alexander

texts.es: Javier es un joven muy trabajador quien se dedica a la albañilería, vive junto a su compañera de vida y junto a su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Debido a que viven en la casa de la familia de Javier, él ha construido una pequeña galera para vivir aparte, en donde desea construir un muro de división, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena y de este modo contar con su pequeño espacio como su casa.
texts.en: Javier is a very hard working young man who works in construction. He lives with his life partner and their little boy, who is one year old. Since thy live in Javier's family's house, he has built a small shed in order to live separately. He wants to build a partition wall there, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, so that he can have the money to buy bricks, cement, and sand, and make his small space a home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand to build a wall.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth from Liberia. She is 32 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She has been managing her business for the past ten years to make ends meet. She sells at her business for seven hours each day of the week. She has six children between the ages of 10 and 21; she said only four are currently attending school, and they all live at home. 

She explains that sometimes buying goes slow, but most of the time she realizes a profit, and she uses it to sustain her family.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, Vita (juice drink), etc. for her business. She wishes in the future to build a decent house. She appreciates the support of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, Vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa is 31 years old and lives in West Point. She is unmarried and does not have any child. For the past four years she has been selling soap and charcoal. She started this business with a little amount of money. She learned the business from her mother. What she likes about this business is that it helps her to take care of her home and makes her feel proud of her business. She requested a loan to purchase more soap and charcoal for her business. Her future plan is to build a house and get married.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and charcoal

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 55 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. Melita works very hard to provide for them.

Melita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of items to sell like shampoo, spices, canned goods, milk, etc.

In the future Melita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items to sell like shampoo, spices, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Makay

texts.en:
Makay is 33 years old and married with three children, ages 4 years, 7 years and 12 years. She runs a clothing business in Rokupr, the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for five years and sells wax cotton and jeans.  She says that the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power during rainy season.

Makay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 45 years old and married with 3 children, ages 8 years, 15 years and 20 years. She runs a pharmacy business in Lunsar, the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells cholera and malarial drugs and blood syrup. She says that her business is doing well because, out of her business, she is able to take care of her family and help her community with heath care. 

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy cholera and malarial drugs and blood syrup for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and take care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to open a big pharmacy. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cholera and malarial drugs and blood syrup for resale in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
This is Genie. She previously obtained a PHP 20,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy still more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from her business definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Genie dreams of expanding her business and having more products. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet every week. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 37 years old and married with four children who are in school.

Monaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase household goods like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

Monaliza borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and video rentals.

Monaliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
Magdaleno  es un hombre soltero de 25 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a su tía y primas en el Barrio Chuitinamit,  San Antonio Palopo, Sololá.
 
El es un hombre trabajador  que desea sacar adelante a su familia. El se dedica a dos actividades la primera es la albañilería que desde hace 10 años viene ejerciendo esta labor la cual  lo realiza por las mañanas,  y  por las noches se dedica a la pesca  desde hace 8 años, esto lo realiza porque le gusta y además obtiene ingresos y ganancias buenas que le ayudan contribuir con los gastos de su familia.

El  ahora cuenta con 18 años de experiencia en las labores que realiza, por lo que ha observado que le genera buenas ganancias es por ello que esta solicitado un préstamo de Q 9,000.00  para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, piedrín y hierro para poder construir su vivienda.

Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Magdaleno is 25 years old, single, and lives with his aunt and cousins in the Chuitinamit neighborhood of the municipality of San Antonio Palopó in the Sololá department of Guatemala.

Magdaleno describes himself as a hard-working person, and he says he wants to help his family get ahead. Magdaleno works two jobs. For the past ten years he has worked mornings as a mason. Eight years ago he also began working evenings as a fisherman. He says he enjoys fishing, and the income is good, which lets him help with his family’s expenses. 

Magdaleno says he earns a good income because he has 18 years of experience in both jobs. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 GTQ to buy construction materials such as cement, gravel and iron bars to build his own home. He says his dream is to finish building his home so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Basam Group

texts.en:
The Basam group consists of four women and one man. They live in Taiz, Yemen. This community is hardworking and works as much as they can in order to offer better living conditions. They are requesting a loan for 210,000 YER. 

Maghnia is the leader of the group. She is 34 years old and married. She has a small house. She went through a lot of effort to save money with her husband to set up her house. She is aiming to complete her house with a loan of 30,000 YER, which she will use to buy wood for her house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and turn on electric service.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta. She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy curtains, and other home trappings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise like a variety of lace, curtains, and other home trappings needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to fulfill her daily needs and her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Loreta dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes for a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise like a variety of lace, curtains, and other home trappings needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es: Norma, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Hace 4 años inicio vendiendo mercadería como ser ropa nueva para damas, caballeros y niños, cosméticos, accesorios para damas, y sandalias. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 18,000 Lempiras y es el ciclo número 16 que ha mantenido con ODEF, con este préstamo va surtir de mercadería como ropa nueva, sandalias y cosméticos para ofrecer variedad de productos y mantener surtido el negocio. Su plan es poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Norma, 40, is married, has a daughter, and lives in Arizona, Atlántida. Four years ago, she started selling merchandise such as new women's, men's, and children's clothing, cosmetics, women's accessories, and sandals. She has applied for a loan of 18,000 lempiras, and this is her 16th loan cycle with ODEF. She will use the funding to buy a variety of merchandise such as new clothing, sandals, and cosmetics to stock her business. Her plan is to support her family and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as new clothing, sandals, and cosmetics to stock her business.

loans.name: Paula Maria

texts.es: Paula, tiene  45 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida.  Ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de forros de muebles, cortinas, sabanas, y otros. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y la vende en su comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es por 13,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar telas  para la elaboración de ropa como forros para muebles, de sillas de comedor y sala, cortinas, manteles, sabanas etc. y cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes. Su meta es incrementar los ingresos y sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Paula, 45, lives in a free union with her husband, with whom she has two children. They live in Esparta, Atlántida.  She has been making covers for furniture and chairs, curtains, tablecloths, and sheets for 10 years. She works from her house and sells in her neighborhood.

She has applied for a loan of 13,000 lempiras to buy fabric to make covers for furniture and chairs, curtains, tablecloths, sheets, and more to fill customer orders. Her goal is to increase her income and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make covers for furniture and chairs, curtains, tablecloths, sheets, and more.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Ella lleva 7 años de tener su propia pulpería donde vende granos básicos, embutidos, carnes, lácteos, refrescos, pan, huevos, manteca, azúcar, jabón, dulces etc. Ha mantenido activo su negocio por la inversión de 7 prestamos anteriores, actualmente solicita el octavo ciclo  que es por 27,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa y sandalias para vender en el mismo local de la pulpería y poder mejorar las ventas y los ingresos ofreciendo variedad de productos. Su objetivo es incrementar las ganancias y que el negocio crezca.
texts.en: Maria, 50, is married, has three children, and lives in Masica, Atlántida. For seven years, she has managed her own store, where she sells grains, canned goods, meats, milk products, beverages, bread, eggs, margarine, sugar, soap, sweets, and more. She has had seven loans, which she has invested in her business, and is now in her eighth loan cycle. She has applied for funding of 27,000 lempiras to buy clothing and sandals to sell in her small store so that she can increase her sales and selection. Her goal is to increase profits and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Suzanne est une femme Camerounaise de 45 ans. mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont le plus âgé à 23 ans et le moins âgé 09 ans, Suzanne vend des légumes,épices et céréales dans un marché de la place depuis près de 10 ans. ne disposant pas d'un stock assez consistant, elle souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter les sacs de d'oignons, d'arachides et d'haricots. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activité et lui permettront également d'assurer l'avenir de sa progéniture.
texts.en: Suzanne is a Cameroonian woman of 45 who is married with three children. The oldest is 23 and the youngest is ten years old. Suzanne has been selling vegetables, spices and cereals at a local market for nearly 10 years. As her stock is not consistent, with the money from the loan she would like to buy bags of onions, groundnuts and beans. The profits obtained will be reinvested in her business and will also enable her to provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase goods.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marissa works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Marissa is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell to her customers. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIARADOUGOU, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Mme  AOUA  debout  en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0.5 ha. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average 40 years old with four children and all of whom live in polygamous families in Niaradougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to manage their farming activities in winter.
This is their fourth loan from the institution, the previous loans were correctly repaid
Mrs. Aoua who is standing second from the left in the photo cultivates rice.
With her loan she plans to pay for labouring costs, seeds and fertilizer for 0.5 ha. After the harvest she sells the crop in the village, at Sikasso to her male and female customers. 
She hopes to make a profit of 100.000 francs CFA per field.
This profit will enable her to reimburse her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 64 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, pero ahora solo con uno de sus hijos en sus casa propia.  Con mucho esfuerzo Marcelina pudo poner una cafetería en su localidad, con la ayuda de su fallecido esposo pudo equiparlo muy bien y poco a poco lo convirtió en un lugar muy conocido y concurrido. La comida que sirve es muy buena, es por eso que es muy visitada por sus vecinos. Ahí vende café, panqueques (comida a base de harina), y demás bebidas, los cuales vende mayormente en las noches. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tener su negocio limpio, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender a tantas personas a la vez, ya que muchas veces ella no se da abasto. Además cuenta que abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles para cubrir las necesidades de sus vecinos. Para su futuro desea ahorrar lo suficiente para poder pasar una vejez tranquila. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Amelia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de ingredientes como quesos, manjar blando, frutas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 64, is widowed and has four children; however, she lives with just one of her children in her own house. She worked hard with her now deceased husband to equip and open a cafe in her house, which slowly became a well-known, busy place. She serves great food, which is why the neighbors come often. She offers coffee, pancakes, and beverages, and most of her sales are in the evening. She likes keeping her business clean.

Marcelina has been operating her business for 10 years. The most difficult part is waiting on a lot of customers at once, and ofter it is hard to cope. She also opened a small grocery store to serve her neighbors needs. She wants to have enough savings to live comfortably in her later years. 

This is her four loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding to keep going. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of 1000 soles to buy supplies such as cheese, caramel, coffee, and fruit.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as cheese, coffee, and fruit.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich, 28 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Pursat, a province of Cambodia. She has a position in a market to help her husband, who works as a mechanic in an auto repair shop, earn a stable living. Through their hardships, they aim to provide enough for their children and help them with school. 

Pich wants the house they live in to become healthier by having a latrine for use. So she is requesting a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy construction supplies and pay for labor. By doing so, she can lessen some of the infectious diseases that are caused from waste, promote their health, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

She is very happy and grateful for the constant support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay for labor to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 26 years old and single. Jenelyn works very hard to provide her needs and sustain her business.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Blanca Neptalia

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace 9 años tiene un negocio de sala de belleza y barbería donde ofrece los servicios de  cortes de cabello, aplicación de tintes, tratamientos  y planchado de cabello para dama. Este salón lo tiene establecido en su casa, en un local que ha podido acondicionar con las ganancias obtenidas. Ella ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente esta solicitando el decimo ciclo que es por 5,000 Lempiras para la compra de productos de belleza como ser tintes, Gillette,  espumas, champú,  tratamientos etc. para uso y venta en el salón. Su meta es seguir con el negocio ya que esto la hace sentir útil y es un aporte para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Blanca is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  She has been operating a beauty salon and barber shop for nine years and offers services such as haircuts, hair coloring, treatments, and hair straightening for women.  Her salon is located in her home, a location that has been equipped for her income-generating business.  

Blanca has maintained her business by investing several loans.  She is currently requesting her tenth loan in the amount of 5,000 HNL so that she can buy beauty products such as dyes, Gillette razors, shaving cream, shampoo, treatments, and other products to use and sell in her salon.  Her goal is to continue her business since it makes her feel useful and allows her to contribute to her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy dyes, razors, shaving cream, shampoo, treatments, and other products.

loans.name: Jevy

texts.en:
Jevy is 36 years old and married, with three children.

Jevy works hard to provide for his family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and he has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items to sell in his general store, like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, and snack foods.

Jevy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the general store for five years and he also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Jevy aspires to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his general store, like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, and snack foods.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre agricultor de 25  años de edad, el está soltero  y  vive junto a su hija de 5 años en el Caserío Xolbé, Cantón El Tablón, Sololá, Sololá.
 
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando  repollo  a unos kilómetros  de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde pequeño. Viendo la necesidad de crear su propio negocio decide cultivar y comercializar su producto que le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias.
El ahora cuenta con 10 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas en esta actividad. De este modo el solicita un préstamo de Q 3,500.00  para la compra de pilones de repollo y abono orgánico  para poder cultivar y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 
Su mayor sueño es la compra de un terreno  para ampliar su cultivo y así generar mejores ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 25 years old and a farmer.  He is single and lives with his five-year-old daughter in a hamlet called Xolbé in the El Tablón canton of Sololá.

Alfredo makes a living growing cabbage a few kilometres from his home.  He learned this trade from a young age, with his father.  Seeing a need to start his own business, Alfredo decided to grow and sell his product - this has given him good profits and a good income.

Given his good profits, Alfredo has continued with this work and now has ten years experience.  He is applying for a loan of 3500 Qetzal in order to buy cabbage baskets and organic manure.  With this he can continue growing and harvesting cabbage, and can improve his income in order to support his family.

Alfredo's biggest dream is to buy a plot of land in order to increase his crops and thus earn more money to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cabbage baskets and organic manure.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo, es una persona de 69, sus estudios los realizo hasta 9° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando es que en ese tiempo no existía el nivel de bachillerato; desde entonce él comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su padre. Luego, con el tiempo, trabajo en un taller de estructura metálicas hasta hoy en día sigue trabajando.

Su  familia esta conformada por su esposa, que se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maíz molido, y también tiene dos hijos una niña y un varón, los dos están en la escuela, la niña esta a un nivel de 7°grado y  tiene  12 años de edad y el varón esta en 4°grado que tiene una edad de 6 años. Los niños le ayudan a la señora a repartir los encargo de tortillas que le llegan a solicitar a su casa.  

Timoteo posee un taller instalado en su casa, él fabrica balcones, ventanas, puertas para las casas. Ademas, de eso realiza camas metalices para pick up;  desde hace 20 años de experiencia, es muy conocido en la zona.

Este trabajo lo aprendió en un taller que existió en la ciudad. Luego se preparo para salirse del taller como empleado,  ahorro su dinero para comprar el equipo que necesitaba para establecer el taller y tomo la decisión de formar su taller; por que él veía que entraba mucho dinero siendo independiente que estar de empleado; él también se dedica al transporte de agua a las personas que se lo solicitan.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 1 quintal de hierro, electrodos y reparar o comprar una nueva maquina para soldar, pero también piensa reparar un desperfecto mecánico que tiene el carro. 

Pues el crédito que a solicitado le mejorara su condición de vida, porque así tendrá el material para seguir trabajando; ya que menciona que en un futuro desea, terminar de arreglar su casa que le falta el repello y afinado de la pared de la casa para tenerla finalmente terminada
texts.en:
Timoteo, is a 69 year old person, his studies were completed up to 9th grade, the reason why he wasn't able to continue with his studies is because at that time high school didn't exist, so he started working in agriculture with his father.  Later, as time went by, he worked in a metal shop and continues to work in that activity today.

His family includes his wife, who sells corn tortillas and two children a girl and a boy, both in school, the girl is in 7th grade and is 12 years old, the boy is in 4th grade and is 6 years old.  The children help her mom to fill the tortilla orders that come to their house.

Timoteo has the shop at his residence, he makes balconies, windows and doors for houses.  He also makes metal bodywork for pick up trucks; he has 20 years of experience, he is very well known in the area.

He learned this trade at a shop that used to be in the city. He then got ready to quit the shop, saved some money to buy some equipment he needed to start a shop and decided to start a shop of his own, he saw that he could earn a lot of money by being independent than being an employee, he also works distributing water to people that need it.

The loan requested is to buy 100 kg of iron, electrodes and to fix or purchase a new welding machine, he also wants to fix a mechanical issue his car has.

The loan he requested will improve his life conditions, because he will have materials to continue working, he indicates that in the future he hopes to finish fixing his house that needs wall touch-ups to have it finally completed.

loans.use: to buy 100 kg of iron, electrodes and to fix or purchase a new welding machine, he also wants to fix a mechanical issue his car has.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol Philippines. She is 51 years old, married with three children ages 15, 19 and 21. Imelda owns a transportation business through her 'motorella' (motorized carriage). Her husband helps by driving for passengers in their area. She is asking for a loan of 7000 PHP to buy motor oil, tires and gasoline. She hopes to make a good profit out of her business so she can support her children's needs. Her profit will be for school fees and food for her family. In the future, Imelda hopes to have other businesses so that  her children will be able to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, tires and gasoline

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NIARADOUGOU, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Mme  SALIMATA debout  au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour, la semence et les engrais  pour entretenir 0.5 ha. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 11 group are married women who are on average 41 years old with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Niaradougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to manage their farming activities during the winter.
This is their fourth loan from the institution, the previous loans were repaid correctly.
Mrs. Salimata who is standing in the middle in the photo cultivates rice.
With the loan she plans to pay for labour, seeds and fertilizer for the upkeep of 0.5 hectares. She sells the crop in the village, at Sikasso after the harvest to men and women customers.
She hopes to make a profit of 75.000 francs CFA per field.
The profits will enable her to repay her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Elmelyn

texts.en:
This is Elmelyn, 28, a resident of Batasan Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a merchandiser, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elmelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a small amount of shampoo, a bit of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a direct selling business and a piggery for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Elmelyn dreams to be a wholesaler and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy household goods like soap, milk, shampoo and soft drinks for her general store business.

Evelyn has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from food vending.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods like soap, milk, shampoo and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
This is Karlo, 22, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. His partner is Mischelle, and they have children. He, together with his partner, manage their household while operating the business. He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Karlo oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

Karlo dreams that his jeepney is always in good condition and hopes to give his children a good and quality education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 47 years old, married with three children, and work very hard to help her husband increase her family income.

Nenita has a nipa roof-making business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo and ratan.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials such as nipa leaves, bamboo, and ratan for her nipa roof-making business.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Aziz is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now, she lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Her daughter goes to preschool, and her son is a newborn. Her daughter wants to be a painter. Aziz started her new business, raising chickens, 5 month ago. Now she needs a loan of 2,100 AZN to buy chickens. She wants to use the money for her children's future. In the future, Aziz wants to have a big farm, as this will be more profitable for her business. Aziz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Safina, who is in her late teens, is single.  She has been making a living by selling vegetables for one year now. She works from 5 a.m. to  8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 
 
This will be Safina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for increasing her stock of vegetables. She dreams of opening a retail shop where she can sell things like rice, sugar, and maize flour.
  
Safina will share this loan with her loan group “SUBIRA” with six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en: Rodulfo is married and resides in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, along with his family. He goes fishing and at the same time he is engaged in a business buying and selling crabs and shrimp. Rodulfo has successfully repaid his previous loan from Gata Daku MPC which he had used to purchase fishing equipment. Recently, he borrowed a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more crabs and shrimp to sell in the market and in bulk. In the future, Rodulfo wants to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs and shrimp to sell in the market and in bulk

loans.name: Juba Group

texts.en:
Tida, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are in school. Since 2007, Tida has been managing her family responsibilities by running a retail shop, selling items like flour, sugar, match boxes, soaps of different types, cooking oil, airtime and other consumable and durable items. She is doing her shop activities normally from 7:30 to 8:00 pm daily, and is able to make a good return per month.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this will be her first loan request. Tida will use this loan to restock more items in her shop. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a wholesale shop.
 
Tida will share this loan with her loan group, Juba, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more items in her retail shop.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova works hard to support her family. She has five children, three of whom are in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nova requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future, Nova would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 16 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and pig fattening.

Ronita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 27,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She hopes to save enough money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a 37-year-old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming alongside distilling local brew. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade in wholesale and also venture into modernized agriculture. Dennis is requesting a loan to buy tomato herbicides for spraying.

loans.use: to buy tomato herbicides for spraying.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell

loans.name: Virginia De Jesus

texts.es:
Virginia de 37 años de edad, es casada; pero en este momento se encuentra separa de su esposo, vive con sus tres hijos, el mayor trabaja de jornalero y ayudante de albañil y los otros van a la escuela de la comunidad ellos le apoyan económicamente. Estudio solo hasta cuarto grado en la escuela, ya que tenia que trabajar desde pequeña. 

Ella se dedica a moler tortillas para una vecina todos los días de 7:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. y los fines de semana hacen ventas en la casa con su hija, venden refrescos y meriendas a las personas que pasan por ahí y a los jugadores de una cancha de fútbol que esta cerca. Posee  amplia experiencia en actividades de comercio, a trabajado toda su vida desde que estaba pequeña y desde que se caso le gusto dedicarse a actividades de este rubro. Antes de hacer esto la cliente tenia el cafetín de la escuela y un negocio de tortillas en la ciudad cuando estaba con su esposo.    

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para iniciar un negocio de compra y venta de ropa para todas las edades y elaborar pupusas los fines de semana,  y así tener mejores ingresos ya que ahora trabaja duro y se esfuerza mucho para sobrevivir con sus hijos en cambio, si el negocio es propio se gana mas aunque se trabaje pero se ven los resultados.   
La idea con el préstamo, es tener los ingresos necesarios y la estabilidad económica en el negocio ya que su hija este año se graduá del nivel básico de estudio y el otro año deberá ir al instituto y abra que darle para los pasajes y la comida,  espera también que el hijo menor estudie el otro año y se prepare academicamente y que puedan tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Virginia, 37, is married, although she is currently separated from her husband. She lives with her three children, the eldest works as a day worker and bricklayer's assistant and the others go to the local school and support her financially. She only reached the fourth grade at school as she had to work from a young age.

She makes tortillas for a neighbour every day from 7am until 2pm and at the weekends she sells things at home with her daughter. They sell drinks and snacks to people who pass buy and players from a local football court. She has a lot of experience in commerce, having worked her whole life since she was a young girl and since getting married she has enjoyed working in this industry. Previously, she had a school cafe and a tortilla business in the city when she was with her husband. 

The loan she is requesting, is to start a business buying and selling clothes for all ages and making pupusas at weekends, this will let her have a better income as she works hard and struggles to survive with her children. If the business is her own she will earn more as at the moment she works without seeing the results.

The idea of the loan is to have the necessary income for financial stability in the business as this year her daughter will graduate with a basic level of education, next year she will start at secondary school and will need money for the journey and food. She also hopes that her younger son will continue studying and prepare academically so he will have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to start a business buying and selling clothes for all ages and to make pupusas at the weekend.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en: Aleksandre is a 48-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and son in the small village of Tskaltubo district. His wife is a housekeeper. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows and produce dairy products for selling. Besides this, they have a small plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, he decided to start his own business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Aleksandre received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo--a startup program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or restart businesses.  With the loan of 1,000 GEL, he will build a greenhouse and grow cucumbers and tomatoes there. He will sell the harvested products locally at a good price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income they will be able to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Mahlia Group

texts.en:
The Mahlia group consists of three women and one man. They live in Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan for 120,000 YER. 

Mahlia is the leader of this group. She is 49 years old and is a housewife who has a small house. She is requesting a loan from AMB for 30,000 YER, which she will use to buy construction supplies to complete building her house. She hopes to own big house to live in with her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is 40 years old. He is married and the father of two beautiful children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sadiq and his wife are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet their family's needs. He has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 13 years. During these years, he gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of his business. 

He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. He also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to his neighbors. His monthly income is about 144 AZN. This business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now Sadiq would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. He will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be his fourth loan with AqroInvest, and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Granada Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Granada” está conformado por mujeres y un hombre es un grupo que pertenece a la comunidad de Dolores Hidalgo una comunidad muy pequeña y tranquila. Los integrantes siempre han sido muy unidos y responsables con la institución. Doña María Altagracia es integrante del grupo es mujer mayor con 80 años de edad sin embargo tiene muchas fuerzas a todo  ella es mujer viuda tuvo 12 hijos de los cuales todos ya son independientes, Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y guajolotes para venderlos, por 60 años he ha dedicado  a dicha actividad que aprendió de su mamá, también se dedica la elaboración de fajas tradicionales son prendas culturales de la comunidad donde ella vive, otra de sus actividades es la venta de detergente. Doña Altagracia viaja al municipio para surtirse de producto para después venderlo en su comunidad sin embargo ella misma se encarga de preparar el cloro lo único que compra y para eso está solicitando su crédito es para adquirir clorito es una sustancia el cual utiliza Doña Altagracia para preparar la sustancia. Sus vecinas llegan a la casa de Doña Altagracia para comprarle detergente y cloro. Platica que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de productos de mercería vendía en otros municipios sin embrago ahora con su edad ya no puede desplazarse con facilidad, Comenta no presentar ninguna dificultad en sus actividades las realiza con tanto esmero para no perder sus clientes de tantos años y así obtener algo de ganancias para solventar sus gastos. Ella vive sola, el único sueño de Doña Altagracia es seguir trabajando y no abandonar lo que tanto le gusta sus negocios. Los integrantes como Doña Altagracia están muy agradecidos con KIVA y VisionFund porque gracias a los créditos han podido acrecentar sus negocios Doña Eulalia, Blanca Estela, María Severiana, Isidro y Doña Yolanda su crédito lo utilizaran criar y engorada animales como pollos guajolotes, pollos y cerdos, Doña Ofelia en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The communal bank “La Granada” comprises several women and one man from the small, peaceful town of Dolores Hidalgo. The members are united and have been responsible in their dealings with the institution. Though one of the members, María Altagracia, is 80, she works very hard. She is a widow and the mother of 12 grown children. For 60 years, she has been raising chickens and turkeys, a trade she learned from her mother. She makes traditional skirts, which are part of her community's culture, and she sells detergent. 

Altagracia travels to the city to buy merchandise to sell in her town, but she prepares the detergent herself with the chlorine she buys. She has applied for a loan to buy chlorine, which she will use to make detergent. Neighbors come to Altagracia's house to buy both chlorine and detergent. She says she used to sell linens in other towns, but, at her age, it's hard to travel. She says she doesn't face any particular problems in her businesses. She does her work enthusiastically to keep her long-time customers and to have some income to pay her household expenses. She lives alone.

Altagracia's single dream is to keep working and keep the businesses she enjoys going. She is very grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for the funding that has helped the members, Eulalia, Blanca Estela, María Severiana, Isidro, and Yolanda, grow their businesses. They will use this loan to raise animals such as chickens, turkeys, and pigs. Ofelia has a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys, as well as chlorine.

loans.name: Kijichi Group

texts.en:
Martina, who is in her late 20s, is single with a daughter who is in school. For one year now, she has been running a grocery business offering drinks like water, beers, spirits, soda, juice, etc. 

Martina, one year before her business started-up, was employed in someone's grocery where she saved some money to start her own. 

She is also looking forward to expanding her business by selling bites like fried chickens, roast meat, and chips. She starts working from 11 a.m. to mid-night daily and is able to make a very good return per month.
 
This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock more grocery drinks and expand her business by selling bites like fried chicken, roast meat, and chips.

Martina dreams that one day she will be able to open a big grocery(Bar).
 
She will share this loan with her loan group, Kijichi. which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more grocery drinks and expand her business by selling bites like fried chicken, roast meat, and chips.

loans.name: Adile

texts.en:
Adile is 56 years old. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzuli refugee. She breeds sheep and cattle for meat purposes for local butchers. Adile has 20 years of experience in this field, and she thanks her husband, who taught her how to look after cattle and who helps her to run the business. Her husband is currently on a pension.

Adile usually buys small cattle and sheep, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings an income of 300 Azerbaijan new mantas (AZN) per month. Beef and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt sauce. She also sells sheep wool, which is useful for clothing and blankets. 

Adile applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN to purchase three cattle and eight sheep. This will be her third loan, and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and eight sheep.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Don Julio  de 57 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, hace 10 años se dedica a la sastrería junto con su familia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Julio solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como hilos, agujas, telas, botones, etc. y pago de mano de obra para la elaboración de uniformes escolares, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio is 57 years old.  He is very hard-working and responsible.  He lives in his own house with his wife and daughter.  For ten years Julio has been making a living in tailoring with his family.  With the earnings from his business he is able to cover some household costs.  Julio is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies such as threads, material, needles, buttons and other supplies, and to pay workers.  These supplies and workers helped to make school uniforms.  Julio hopes that this loan will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy threads, material, needles, buttons and other supplies, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Age 58 and a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Thol is a mother of five children. She endures her family’s difficulty by rice farming. This is the business that she has engaged in for ages. Her husband works for others for a fee for additional income, and he also helps her on her farmland. 

Thol is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan wisely and it enabled her to support her living at a gradual pace. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her paddy rice farming business. Therefore, she seeks a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to pay a plowing fee and a leasing fee for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and make good profit for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to pay a plowing fee and a leasing fee for her farmland.
