Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500.00 Jorge comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros.
texts.en:
Jorge is 57 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his wife and two grandchildren, Jorge is a very hardworking man and makes a living selling food products. As a supplemental activity, he provides transportation services on his mototaxi. 

Jorge started his grocery store when he decided to sell his two mules. He invested the money that he made by purchasing some products. Now, he works with loans that help him to continue to grow his business. 

A problem that he faced before he started his business was the death of his son, which deeply affected him emotionally. After a few months, he overcame it because he wanted to move forward with his grandchildren. 

Thanks to this business, he improved his family's quality of life. This is his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support that he has received to move forward. He promises to make his monthly payments on time. With the loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, Jorge will buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Akner village where she lives with her husband and two little children (her daughter is in the photo).  Gayane's husband works at a local company.  Gayane does not work, as she has to take care of her children, but she has been involved in the farming business for 5 years.  Gayane owns a plot of land where she cultivates haricot, potato, onion, and garlic.  She sells the gathered harvest to local retailers who come and take the harvest from her house.  As there are only a few tractors in the whole community, locals have to rent it from tractor owners in order to organize the cultivation process.  Gayane also needs to rent a tractor to start autumn sowing.  For doing this she needs to purchase fuel and, unfortunately, she has insufficient funds.    

This hard working woman with good credit history requests 3,000 USD to pay for fuel and fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land.  Gayane plans to purchase a large amount of fuel to receive a 20% discount and to keep it for the whole season.

Gayane hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Doris was born in 1968 but is still determined to work until she gets her dream in life. She is a member of this group, which is located in the southern part of Teshie-Ghana. She has so far borrowed four loan cycles from ID-Ghana through its Teshie branch and has now applied for a loan of GHS 800 to be able to boost her business by buying soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola), cooking oil and noodles. She is an enterprising lady who has seen her business grow from one level to another since 2000. Her clients are mainly people from the nearby locality and the locals of Teshie. Doris is hard working and honest and this has helped her a lot to grow the business despite the challenges of inflation and competition. She believes that the profit from the business will help her achieve her dream in life.

The other colleague sells fish and together they need a total amount of GHS 1800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cooking oil and noodles for her business.

loans.name: Safani

texts.en:
Safani is 50 years old and married with 4 children. He makes tents and bouncing castles for children. His wife also provides additional income to support the family. He has been in this business for the past 26 years and it has been profitable.

He will use this loan amount to buy material for making the bouncing castles and tents for selling. He intends to use the generated income to build a house on his plot of land. This is his fourth loan term from KADET LTD. 

Safani hopes to grow his business and be able to educate his children as well as improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more material for making bouncing castles.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en: Maima is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 11 and 14 years old.  Her children are in school and they all live in Montserrado County, which is the capital and number one commercial city in Liberia.  For five years she has been running her own cook shop, selling rice and soup.  She has more customers and makes more profit every day.  She started her business with money from her husband, a businessman, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.  She spends eight hours on her business each day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, and other items to expand her business.  She plans to expand her business even more and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 24-year-old woman married to Kennedy.  She is a mother of two children.  Eunice sells secondhand clothes in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years.  She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Eunice's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to buy new clothes for resale.  In future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Allakagni Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe    ALLAKAGNI  sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  Loulouni un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme    BATOGOMA en position assise à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de  fruits et légumes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 10 régimes de bananes, 5 paniers d’orange qu’elle revendra en détail au marché  et à Sikasso  à une place fixe à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the ALLAKAGNI group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old and also have an average of four children each. Most of these women live in monogamous families in Loulouni, a village located in the Sikasso region (third adminitrative region of Mali).

They are on their seventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and this loan will help them to meet the needs of their customers.

Batogoma, one of the group's members, sells fruits and vegetables.  In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy ten bunches of bananas and five baskets of oranges which she will resell on a retail basis at the market and in Sikasso, in a fixed location. Her customer base consists of men and women who pay her in cash.

Batogoma is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the extra money will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny  es una joven estudiante de 20 años de edad, ella estudia la carrera de educación en una Universidad local, en la actualidad estudia y trabaja como auxiliar de educación en una escuela de su sector, esto le permite ir desarrollando su carrera y ganar experiencia.Yeny ha solicitado este préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de la universidad y comprar algunos materiales de estudio, esta agradecida a los prestamistas de KIVA  por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Yeny is a 20-year-old student. She studies education at the local university. Currently, she studies and works as a teacher's assistant at a school in her sector. This allows her to develop her career and gain experience.

Yeny requests this loan to make monthly tuition payments to the university and to buy some school materials. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to make monthly tuition payments.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 25-year-old married woman with one child (1yr old).  Sarah has a milk shop and distributes milk in Nairobi.  She has been in this business for 6 years. 

She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more fresh milk to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to improve the standards of the business.  Having successfully repaid her first loan, this will be her 2nd loan with KADET LTD. 

Sarah hopes to be successful in her business, to educate her child, to be self-reliant, and to be successful in life and in her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk.

loans.name: Baslisa

texts.en:
Baslisa is a single mother of five children.  She sells groceries in Kangemi and has been doing so for thirteen years.  She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Baslisa's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire amount to buy groceries for her store.  In the future, she wants to educate her children and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and potatoes for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children.  Her children are in school and range in age between 12 and 19 years old.  They all live in Montserrado County, which is the capital and number one commercial city in Liberia. 

Mary stopped her education at grade 3.  For nine years, she has been involved in the sale of sweet-potatoes-greens.  She enjoys the flow of her many customers.  She started her business with a loan from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.  She spends eight hours each day on her business.  Low income is the biggest challenge that she face in her business since she does not have enough money to meet her customer’s range.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more sweet-potatoes-greens for her business.  She plans to expand her business even more and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet-potatoes-greens for her business.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is married with five school-going children.  They live at their own house that is without electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanapili has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past five years.  She sells from home to her neighbors.  She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.  With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.  She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old, industrious gentleman.  He is married to Mercy, who brings additional income to the family through her milk-selling business.  Richard is a father of four children who are between the ages of 3 and 9 years old.  He earns a living through livestock rearing and selling where he makes approximately 28,000 KES per month.  He learned about KADET from a loan officer who was carrying out a marketing campaign in his area of operation.  He has chosen to diversify into the motorcycle transport business, which is a booming business in his local area.

Richard has acquired his first loan of 91,065 KES, which will help him to purchase a new motorcycle.  He will use the increased proceeds to pay school fees for his children and to repay his loan.

His hope is to bring up a wealthy and well-educated family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija con la que vive en su casa propia. Su actividad principal se centra en la agricultura ya que se dedica a la siembra, producción  y venta de granos de cacao y plátano tiene un promedio de 15 años en está actividad.  El principal problema en esta actividad es la fuerte variación que sufre el precio del cacao y plátano. Pero gracias a su experiencia y a sus conocimientos ha logrado sacar adelante su producción lo que ahora espera obtener otros terrenos de cultivo y así mismo cambiar la producción normal por una producción de cacao con certificación orgánica para ofrecer un mejor producto.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el dinero solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará abono orgánico para mejorar su producción.
texts.en: Eva is 34 years old, married and has one daughter, with whom she lives in her own house.  Eva mainly makes a living in farming as she sows, grows and sells cacao and bananas.  She has been doing this work for around 15 years.  The main problem with this work is the great fluctuations in the prices of the crops.  However, thanks to her experience and knowledge, Eva has been able to move forward with her products and she now hopes to buy more land and start to produce certified, organic cacao.  She will then be able to offer a better product.  This is Eva's first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for this financial support.  She promises to make her repayments punctually.  Eva will use the 1000 Nuevo Soles to buy organic manure in order to improve production.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: San Sebastian - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN SEBASTIAN - 32  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carol,  tiene 46 casada, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en la zona de la Isla del Sol de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carol utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la Sra. Carol va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de insumos,  su deseo de la Sra. Carol es crecer en su negocio, es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The "San Sebastian - 32" communal bank is made up of eight members - six women and two men.  The bank's president is 46-year-old Carol.  She is married and makes a living selling meals from her stall in the Isla del Sol area of the city of Cochabamba.  This is Carol's first loan cycle with the communal bank and she will use it to buy supplies in bulk,  such as potatoes, rice and pasta, to make the meals,.  With these supplies she will be able to improve her sales and increase her working capital.  Carol chose to apply for this loan because of her lack of supplies.  Carol will use her profits to continue buying supplies.  Carol's wish is to expand her business.  She is hard-working and is happy and grateful for the support being provided with this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to prepare meals.

loans.name: Lendrosh

texts.en:
Lendrosh was born in the village of Srashen, in the Syunik region.  After school, Lendrosh studied at the Kapan Constructional College.  For many years he worked at different companies where he did construction.  But, after he returned to his native village, he became engaged in farming and agriculture. Lendrosh is married and has two daughters and a son.  His daughters are already married and live separately and his son is still school-aged.  

Together with his wife, Lendrosh breeds two cows, a calf, three piglets, and twenty chickens.  On their plot of land they cultivate cereal.  Little by little, Lendrosh teaches his son the details and skills of farming and agriculture.  He thinks that whatever happens and whatever profession his son will choose in the future, Lendrosh hopes that his son will be close to land, nature, and animals that need care and love.

Lendrosh asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a truck and to organize hay-mowing activities.  This will help him to receive a good profit from his agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy a truck and to organize hay-mowing activities.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is considered to be a hardworking and responsible person.  He has been a carpenter for ten years and runs his business out of his home.  As he will have the opportunity, he wants to build a workshop in the yard of his house to avoid renting space.  He repairs sofas and chairs.  He has customers because he does good work and has good prices. 

Seymur lives with his wife and two children in a house with poor living conditions.  He is asking for a loan to start home repair and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to start home repair.

loans.name: Makhir

texts.en: Makhir was born in 1971. He has two grown children who are 15 and 17 years old. He is a security guard at a local company. He receives a monthly salary of 200 AZN. To support his family's nutrition and education, he is engaged in farming. He sells vegetables, fruits and dairy products. Makhir can confidently say that every year his business is doing well in spite of the fact that the profitability of these activities depends on the weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. He is seeking the loan to buy manure, sprinklers, fungicide, and fertilizer so that he can continue to provide good care for his crops and get a high-quality harvest. He will be able to sell the produce for a better price in the market and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy manure, sprinklers, fungicide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura por está razón cultiva cacao y café orgánico, además cuenta con 10 años de experiencia . En sus inicios tuvo muchas dificultades ya que no contaban con el dinero suficiente para adquirir los terrenos pero gracias al apoyo de su padre logró  adquirir los terrenos y comenzar a realizar los sembríos. Con la ganancia de su cosecha logra sacar adelante a su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero solicitado de S/.1500.00, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su cultivos de cacao con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Raquel is 31 years old.  She is a single mother to two children, who live with her in her own house.  Raquel makes a living in farming, growing cacao and organic coffee.  She has ten years experience in this field.  In the beginning Raquel had many difficulties as she did not have enough many to buy any land.  However, thanks to her father's support, she managed to buy land and began sowing her crops.  Raquel is is able to use her profits to help her family to prosper.  This is Raquel's first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  Raquel will use the 1500 Nuevo Soles to invest in maintaining her cacao crops by buying organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her crops.

loans.name: Las Unidas - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento  LAS UNIDAS - 32  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mariela,  ella se se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mariela va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de refrescos por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio,  la Sra. Mariela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que este préstamo le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Las Unidas - 32 Communal Bank is made up of seven women and one man.

Mariela's the president of the bank.  She makes a living selling a variety of soft drinks in her sales stall that's located in a very busy market in the city of Cochabamba.

This loan is Mariela's second sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy a variety of soft drinks wholesale to stock her stall and offer her customers a variety of products.  She's requesting this loan to keep on improving her business.

Mariela's a very hardworking person.  She's happy for this opportunity because this loan will help her grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogamiques au quartier Lafiabougou de  Loulouni un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  ANCHATA en première position de la gauche vers la droite fait le commerce de   condiments.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 30 kg d’oignon 1 panier de poivre, du sel, du soumbala ainsi que du piment qu’elle revendra en détail au marché ainsi qu’à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguisseme group are married women with an average age of 40 years and 4 children each. They live mostly in monogamous families in the Lafiabougou neighborhood of Loulouni, one of the towns in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their third loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yirwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Anchata, pictured in first position from left to right, is in the spice business. She plans to use her loan to purchase around 30 kg of onions, 1 basket of pepper, salt, and some soumbala and seasonings that she will resell at retail for cash in the market as well as from her home to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA, of which a portion will be used to pay off the loan and interest and the remainder will go to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda  es una señorita soltera de  18 años de edad. Ella actualmente vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío Central, Aldea Los Encuentros, Sololá, Sololá.
Ella actualmente tiene una tortillería en una tienda de su padre. Eligió esta actividad ya que de esta manera puede aportar a la economía de su familia. Comenta que por las mañanas se dedica a la tortillería y por las tardes a estudiar, esto lo hace con el fin de superarse para ayudar a su familia.
Ahora lleva 5 años de realizar esta actividad que cada día existe más demanda, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de una estufa más grande ya que con la otra no se da abasto para la elaboración de sus tortillas.
Su meta es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio para poder seguir estudiando y graduarse en el nivel medio, para tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Brenda is a single young woman of 18 years. She currently lives with her parents in the Caserío Central, Aldea Los Encuentros, Sololá, Sololá.

She currently has a tortillería in her father's shop. She chose this activity because in this way she can contribute to her family's finances. In the morning she works at the tortillería, and she studies in the afternoon, which she does with the goal to better herself so she can help her family.

She has run this business for 5 years, and every day there is greater demand. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of Q 5,000 to buy a larger stove, now that she cannot keep up tortilla preparation with the other. Her goal is to generate more earnings across the board so she may continue studying and graduate from school to obtain better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy a stove to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Dúo Crisastemo Group

texts.es: Dúo Crisastemo, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Rossemary de 37 años de edad, por muchos años ella se ha dedicado a la venta de granos bsicos(tienda)ella en esta ocacion esta solicitando la ayuda de Kiva ya que gracias a Dios sus clientes han aumentado, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia de granos basicos esperando que por medio de ustedes ella pueda surtir un poco mas su tienda y seguir luchando para estar mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
The Dúo Crisastemo group is made up of Rossemary, who is 37 years old. For many years, she has made her living selling staple goods in a store. 

For this occasion, she is asking for the help of Kiva. Thanks to God, her customers have grown, and she is asking for this loan to buy merchandise, consisting of staple goods. She hopes that with your help she can supply her store a little more and continue striving to be better with her family.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to sell.

loans.name: Jenit

texts.es: Jenit tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. Jenit se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles al por menor,  como  actividad complementaria se dedica a la agrocultura. Jenit  comienza  el  negocio de venta de productos comestibles por la necesidad de contar con este tipo de negocio en su localidad, gracia a su capacidad emprendedora comenzó con el negocio. Gracias a esta actividad mejoro la calidad de vida de su familia.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500.00 comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jenit is a 41-year-old single mother that lives with her son in their own home. Jenit sells foodstuffs retail, and as a secondary job does agroculture. Jenit started to sell foodstuffs because of the need of this type of business in her neighborhood, thanks to her entrepreneurial capabilities. Thanks to this business she has improved the quality of life of her family.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial help she will receive to move forward, and further promises to pay her debts in a timely manner. With the requested loan of S/. 1500 she will buy foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, and canned fish, among others.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, canned fish, and others

loans.name: Mirador De Chumpe Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco MIRADOR DE CHUMPE, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Chumpe, distrito de Lamay  y provincia de Calca.
La socia Inocencia tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 06 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus cliente que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia  saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animalitos.
Al momento de tomar la foto el socio Carlos se agacho para firmar algunos documentos.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesania, crianza de animales menores, venta de ovinos y albañiles.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a member of the"MIRADOR DE CHUMPE" communal bank, which is located in Chumpe, Lamay district, Calca province. Inocencia is 52 years old, married and has six children. She alternates between her daily activities and raising small animals like guinea pigs. She has done this business for a long time now and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she makes daily. She raises the animals and sells them to customers who ask her for them. Inocencia is a responsible and persevering person. This is how she gets her family ahead. 

 Inocencia is asking for this loan to buy guniea pigs and feed for them. She is grateful for the loan granted to the group and she promises to pay her installments on time.

The other members of the communal bank sell handicrafts, raise small animals, sell sheep and bricklay. When the photo was taken the member Carlos was bending over as he had some documents to sign.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Zavur

texts.en: Zavur is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Zavur is married and has two daughters. He started a business raising sheep two years ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan New manat) to expand his farm. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Zavur wants to have more sheep and goats, which will be more profitable for his business. Zavur is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. It is his second loan on Kiva.

loans.use: to expand his farm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old and married to Austine. They have seven children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the business of selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru. She has operated this business for seven years and has applied for her first loan from KADET to enable her to buy clothes for resale. With her anticipated profit, she plans to pay for school fees and also rent a house where she will establish her business. 

In the near future, Lucy hopes to expand her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en: This marks Prudence's fifth loan from KADET Ltd, after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the requested loan to expand her current business by purchasing more cloth material and shoes to sell, which is especially needed because this is the season that schools reopen after a short break. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her children. In the future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Feiruz

texts.en:
This marks Feiruz's second borrowing from KADET Ltd., after servicing her loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase bales of assorted shoes for her stock. Her clientele has grown immensely, and she is doing great.
 
She will use the proceeds to service her loan and open a retail shop for her shoes, and she hopes to become an international business lady in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kour

texts.en:
Kour is 50 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number-one commercial county in Liberia since it has the capital city of Liberia.  

She is a widow and has no children. For the past 12 years, she has been operating a cook shop selling fufu (dough made of cassava), rice and soup.  Kour started this business with assistance from her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She enjoys her business because it helps her to save enough money for expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory like cassava, rice, peppers, oil, meat, fish, etc., for her business. In the near future, she wants to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like cassava, rice, peppers, oil, meat, fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: This marks Jackline's fifth borrowing to finance her business and expand her business premises. Her business has been a success, and she has been able to service her loan well. She will use the anticipated profit and proceeds to pay her daughter's college fee and repay her loan. She hopes her business will remain sustainable and continue to grow big in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a lady of forty-six years, married to Kahira and the mother of two children. She sells used clothes in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years now. She gets a monthly income of twenty-five thousand shillings.

This will be Hannah's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a new stock of clothes to sell. In the future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr:
Mr  DAOUDA représente le groupe DIVINE.  Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il n’a personnes en charge. 
Mr  est gérant d’un kiosque depuis 03ans. Il s’approvisionne à Kilwin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  01carton de lait, 02cartons de spaghetti  et  02 bidons d’huile.
Mr  veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Il  ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité.
texts.en: Daouda represents the Divine group. He is single and has no children or other dependents. He has run a kiosk for three years. He buys his inventory at Kilwin. His customers are men and women. He would like to buy one box of milk, two boxes of spaghetti, and two cans of oil. He would like to save his income to reinvest in his business. He strives to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of milk, 2 boxes of spaghetti, and 2 cans of oil

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 29 years old and blessed with two children. He is a livestock trader in the Lower Melili area of Narok county, Kenya, and has been running the business for the past six years making a monthly income of KES 20000.

He has borrowed a first loan of KES 30000 from KADET with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. He also has plans to use part of the funds to buy planting seeds for the upcoming planting season. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and livestock

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a woman of forty-one years, married to Francis and the mother of four children. She weaves bags, baskets, table mats, etc. in Kiambaa in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Consolata's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy weaving materials like thread, beads, etc. In the future she wants to buy a plot of land and also expand her business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials like beads, thread etc

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 45 years old and married to Saitoti. She supports a family of seven members, her children being ages between 24 and 2 years old. She learned about KADET from a group of some other farmers in her area who are already being funded by KADET. She is a potato farmer in the Enooseyia area of Narok county, Kenya, and she has been in farming for the past 15 years. Her monthly income is KES 10,000 and with this fourth loan of KES 25000 advanced to her, she will purchase farm inputs that include fertilizer and manure.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to expand her farm. Her future dream is to be successful in life and business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Dalila Ester

texts.es:
Dalila es una señorita soltera de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en la 10 Av. 2-30, zona 2, Barrio El Calvario, Sololá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la profesión de maestra en la Escuela Oxlajuj E que se encuentra en Sololá. Eligio esta actividad porque le gusta  trasladar sus conocimientos a los jóvenes para que se superen y sean personas productivas para la sociedad.
 Ella ahora cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en el campo de la educación. Con lo que gana ella puede cubrir  los gastos de su familia y de sus estudios en la Universidad ya que desea sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella esta solicita un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de una computadora, ya que de esta manera podrá trabajar mejor y realizar sus tareas. 
Su sueño es graduarse de Psicóloga en la Universidad para ayudar a muchas personas y poder conformar una familia.
texts.en:
Dalila is a 25-year old single young woman who lives with her parents in the 10th Av. 2-30, zone 2, El Calvario, Sololá, Sololá. She works as a teacher in the Escuela Oxlajuj E, located in Sololá. She chose this profession because she likes to share her knowledge with the children so that they can motivate themselves and become productive members of the society. She now has 7 years of experience in education and can cover household expenses and tuition with what she earns. 

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 Guatemalan quetzales to buy a computer, which will help her with her job and homework. Her dream is to graduate from university as a Psychologist so that she can help many people and build a family.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mirtha Paulina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Mirtha, tiene 37 años  y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 6  y 4 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian en escuela y el menor este año a jardín de infantes. El marido trabaja en una cooperativa de transporte.

Doña Mirtha para obtener sus ingresos para sus gastos y también con esto ayudar a su esposo y para los estudios de sus hijos se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días, lleva más de 10 años en este negocio  y gracias a esto ella puede salir adelante.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es la única forma que tiene para financiar su negocio, le fue muy bien con el crédito anterior y lo que ella gano lo utilizo para pagar ciertas cosas en la escuela de sus hijos ya que eso es lo más importante para ella y en lo que emplea sus ganancias. Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa y cosméticos de Belcorp. Lleva más de 15 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The San Esteban communal bank meets fortnightly in the city of Charapoto, an area which is known for its traditional culture and also for being close to two of the best beaches in the province called San Jacinto and San Clemente.

37-year-old Mirtha lives here with her common-law husband and their three children aged 11, 6 and 4. The two eldest study in school and the youngest will start kindergarten this year. Her husband works in a transportation cooperative.

Mirtha has a retail business, so that she can earn an income to help her husband pay for expenses and the children's education. She sells clothes and shoes by catalog and also sells Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories). She sells her products door to door and works every afternoon. She sells to her customers on credit, which she collects every 15 days. 

Mirtha has been in this business for over ten years and thanks to her work she is able to get by. She is requesting a new loan as it is the only form of financing for her business she has access to. The last loan worked very well and she used her earnings to pay for her children's schooling expenses. The new loan will be used to buy clothes and Belcorp cosmetics. She has been a member of the communal bank for over 15 years, and likes it because the loans have always helped her. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr Adama  est un forgeron né vers 1970 à Fanterela Cercle de Sikasso. Il est père de 12 enfants et vit dans une grande famille à Fanterela (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène des activités de fabrication et ventes de matériels agricoles : daba, houe,  pioche etc ainsi que des seaux d’eau, des arrosoirs etc depuis plus de 30 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 7 ans maintenant, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter du fer qu’il transformera en divers matériels tels que daba, hou, seaux, et arrosoirs. Il s’approvisionne en fer à Bamako ainsi qu’à Sikasso . Les ventes sont généralement faite à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes sur place et au marché des villages environnent de Fanterela et de Sikasso. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama is a blacksmith. He was born circa 1970 in Fanterela, in Sikasso Cercle. He's the father of twelve children and lives in a large family in Fanterela (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

His business, which he has been running for more than 30 years, consists in making and selling farming tools: adzes, hoes, pickaxes, … as well as water buckets, watering cans, ...

His experience in this field earned him a good reputation and he gets orders from a diverse clientele. In order to have the resources required to satisfy his customers, he's been working with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, for seven years. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

This new loan will enable him to buy iron to transform into various tools such as adzes, hoes, buckets, and watering cans. He gets his iron supplies in Bamako and in Sikasso.

He usually sells to a clientele comprising both men and women, in his village and at the market in the surrounding villages in Fanterela and Sikasso.

With this loan, he foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 75'000 (ca US$ 150), which will enable him to repay the loan and interest. The remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy iron to make and sell various tools

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señorita Karina, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella es Ing. en Contabilidad, especialidad que con mucho esfuerzo logro.

Doña Karina para obtener sus ingresos para sus gastos y también con esto ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, hace tres años adecuo un local por el centro de la ciudad en el cual puso una copiadora y luego con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido surtiendo una pequeña papelería, trabaja todos los días  con la ayuda de sus mama que está en el negocio cuando ella no está o sale a comprar los útiles para surtir su local.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que estos son muy importantes para seguir adelante y aumentando su negocio, con sus ganancias ella va comprando cosas necesarias ya que su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio, ella utilizo sus ganancias para comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, este nuevo crédito es para comprar útiles escolares y hojas para la copiadora. Lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho para su negocio. 

Su sueño es aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Esteban Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. The locality is known for its traditional culture and for being only a few minutes from the province's best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Karina lives here in Charapoto. She is 28 year old, single and lives at home with her parents. She has a degree in accounting, something she achieved with a great deal of effort.

In order to make an income to cover her expenses, and also to help her parents with household costs, more than three years ago Karina took over a shop in the city centre. Here she started out with a photocopying machine, and with the help of loans has gradually stocked a small stationer's shop. She works every day, with the help of her mother, who looks after the business when Karina is not there or goes out to buy supplies. 
 
She is seeking another loan as these are very important for her to move forward and expand her business. She invests her profits in things she needs, for example she used them to buy a glass cabinet to display her products, and her goal is to keep growing the business. With this new loan she will buy school supplies and paper for the photocopier.

Karina has been with the communal bank for more than three years and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot with her business. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and photocopier paper.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom, age 46, is a married woman. She is a very talented lady who excels in her stitching work. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of the children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. 

At this time, Kalsoom is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. Kalsoom wants to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is 50 years old married to Lucy. They have three children who are in school.

Obadiah has a retail shop in Naivasha, which he has operated for three years. He has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy stock of rice, flour and sugar among other items. He paid his previous loan on time. With the anticipated profits, he plans to pay the loan and his children's school fees.

Obadiah hopes to see his children well-educated in the near future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and sugar among other items.

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is 32 years old and married. She works as a tailor and has been in this line of work for five years now. She is proud to be a great contributor to her household income. When Ameena was not earning money, her family was going through a financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread earner in the family. 

Her hard work has helped her to establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty fulfilling large orders. For this reason, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in different colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Afou

texts.fr:
Mme AFOU est né en 1968 à Karibougou cercle de Sikasso, elle est mère de 3 enfants et vit chez son époux à Mandela un des village de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle mène des activités commerciales de vente de céréales depuis plus de 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 4 ans maintenant, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt elle achètera  15 sacs de 50 kg de fonio et  5 sacs de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Mandela. Les ventes sont généralement faites à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes sur place et à Sikasso. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afou was born in 1968 in Karibougou, Sikasso Cercle. She's the mother of three children, and lives with her husband in Mandela, one of Sikasso's villages (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

For more than seven years, she's been selling cereals. Her experience in this field earned her a good reputation, and she gets orders from a diverse clientele. In order to have the resources needed to satisfy her customers, she's been working with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, for four years. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

With this new loan, she will buy 15 50-kg sacks of fonio and 5 sacks of corn. She gets her supplies in the villages surrounding Mandela. She usually sells in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, she foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 32'500 (ca US$ 65), which will enable her to pay the interest of the loan. She will invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals (fonio and corn)

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es: Claudia Azucena de 42 años de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, y de este domicilio del departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país,  es propietaria y administradora de un salón de belleza en donde brinda servicios de corte de cabello, peinados, arreglo de manos y pies, además vende cosméticos de varias marcas y líneas como: tintes, cremas limpiadoras, alisados, entre otros , productos de limpieza para el hogar como: asistin cera liquida, cloro, amoniaco, entre otros, negocio que lo inicio hace 12 años de trabajar en belleza, inició su negocio desde muy temprana edad con fondos propios y poco a poco ha logrado darse a conocer obteniendo una buena clientela. Uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar sus ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y verlos realizados profesionalmente. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo del cual comprará productos de limpieza y cosméticos  que ocupa en su negocio. Claudia es una mujer con deseos de superación y muy trabajadora.-
texts.en:
Claudia Azucena, 42, is married and has two minor children.  She lives in the department of Chinandega in the western part of the country.  She owns and manages a beauty salon where she provides services including hair cuts, styling, manicure and pedicure; and she also sells a variety of brands and lines of hair color, cleansing creams, straighteners, home cleaning products such as floor wax, bleach, ammonia, etc.  She has been in the beauty business for 12 years and started with her own money when she was very young.  Little by little she has been able to establish a good customer base.  One of her goals is to increase her income so she can give her children a professional career.

The purpose of the loan is to use it as work capital to buy cleaning products and cosmetics for her business.  Claudia is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy beauty and cleaning products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Antonia Idalinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Antonia, tiene 65 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido no trabaja porque es jubilado.
Doña Antonia desde muy joven aprendió corte y confección, desde hace varios años con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, en esta temporada también elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días cuando tiene mucho trabajo por entregar.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito porque con el anterior le fue muy bien ya que elaboró muchos uniformes de colegios y escuelas, con esto ella tuvo muy buenos ingresos y no le ha faltado trabajo, sus ganancias ella las utiliza para comprar víveres y cosas para su hogar ya que su marido no trabaja y los gastos son muchos. Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres y otros materiales para confeccionar sus prendas.  Lleva 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque son muy unidas en el grupo y se ayudan mutuamente. 

Su sueño es siempre tener salud.
texts.en:
The San Esteban Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. The locality is known for its traditional culture and for being only a few minutes from the province's best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Antonia lives here in Charapoto. She is 65 years old and lives in a common-law marriage, which has produced four children who are now grown-up and independent. Her husband does not work, as he is retired.

Antonio learned fabric-cutting and dressmaking from a very young age. Several years ago, with the aim of earning her own income and making use of her knowledge, she set up a small dressmaking workshop in her home. There she creates all kinds of clothing, although what she most enjoys making is children's clothes. She works to fulfil orders from individual customers, and in the current season she also makes uniforms for the local primary and secondary schools. When she has a lot of orders to deliver, she works every day.

She is seeking another loan because the previous one went very well; she made a lot of school uniforms, and so had a very good income. She has not been short of work, and uses her earnings to buy food and other household items, since her husband no longer works and they have many expenses. She will use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to make her garments. She's been with the communal bank for 12 years, and she likes it because the group is very united and the members help each other out. 

Antonia's dream is always to have good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other supplies to make clothing.

loans.name: Judith Dionela

texts.es:
Judith vive en la ciudad de Ica Con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de arqueología y luego ha estudiado la carrera de secretariado. Judith trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y para poder salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de toldos, en el cual puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día; Judith cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de buena calidad.

Judith está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una vitrina y también más toldos para ofrecer, d esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa construida”.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the city of Ica. With a lot of hard work she was able to study archeology and later she studied to be a secretary. Judith work around 9 hours a day and in order to get ahead and with much effort, she was able to start an awning selling business. She serves up to 10 customers a day. Judith believes that she is getting ahead because she is very friendly to her customers and above all because she offers quality products. 

Judith is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy a display case as well as more awnings to sell. This way, she will improve her income and keep fighting to make her biggest dream come true: build her house.

loans.use: to buy a display case and awnings.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven de 25 años de edad, para poder salir adelante Roberto trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad, asimismo Roberto tiene un pequeño negocio de venta y crianza de gallinas con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra, Roberto trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo atiende bien a los clientes.

Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar alimentos balanceados para su negocio de crianza de animales y de esta manera mejorar su negocio y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 25 year old young man. In order to get ahead, Roberto works as an employee in a transportation business in his city. In addition, Roberto has a small business raising and selling hens for extra income. Roberto works around 8 hours a day and he thinks his work is going well for him because he is responsible and above all gives good customer service.

Roberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, he will be bale to buy balanced feed for his animal raising business and this way, improve his business and keep fighting to make his biggest dream come true: have his own house.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 64 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de imperial y para poder salir adelante junto a su familia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de ventad e cuyes, con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; Augusto cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo atiende a sus clientes de manera amable.

Augusto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá comprar 4 jaulas para poder criar a sus animales de mejor manera y así podrán crecer mucho mejor; así augusto seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una granja muy grande”.
texts.en:
Augusto, 54, lives in the city of Imperial and earns a living selling guinea pigs.  He believes his business is prospering because he is very responsible and kind to his customers.

Augusto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their huge support he will be able to buy four cages so he can raise his animals better.  He wants to continue striving toward his goal of "Having a very large farm".

loans.use: To buy cages

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Doña Benilda, tiene 68 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive con su hija en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Ella lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva y usada como  ser manteles, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior etc. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y es su casa. Ella ha mantenido varios préstamos con ODEF, con el actual son seis ciclos y es por 7,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va surtir de ropa nueva y va comprar sandalias para la venta. Su plan es mejorar su calidad de vida y que su negocio se siga manteniendo para poder cubrir gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Doña Benilda, 68, is widowed and lives with her daughter in the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida. She has been selling new and used clothes for ten years: tablecloths, blouses, pants, underwear, etc. She works both as a street vendor and at home. She has received several loans from ODEF. This is her sixth cycle and she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy new clothes and sandals to sell. Her plan is to improve her quality of life and to maintain her business in time in order to be able to cover her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Verónica Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hermosa hija de 7 años la misma que estudia en una  escuela del sector. Su esposo trabaja en una institución pública. 

Doña Verónica es maestra por contrato en una escuela en San Jacinto, pero además también tiene un bar propio en el cual se dedica a la venta de confitería, helados, sodas, aguas, bocadillos entre otras cosas, ella tiene un pequeño local en una estación de servicios en Charapoto donde también ofrece el servicio de cabinas telefónicas, lleva con su negocio más de siete años y le ha ido muy bien. 

Este crédito es para comprar papas fritas, tostitos, sodas, aguas, energizantes entre otras cosas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace ya 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Sus metas son tener una casa y un local propio ya que son alquilados.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto the San Esteban credit group meets every two weeks. This town is known for its traditional culture and is also only a few minutes from two of the best beaches of the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here lives Verónica. She is 34 years old, married and from that marriage her a beautiful 7 year old daughter. She goes to a local school. Her husband works in a public institution. 

Verónica is a contract teacher at a school in San Jacinto, but she also has her own snack bar where she sells pastries, ice cream, sodas, water, snacks and more. She has a small locale at a gas station in Charapoto, where she also offers a telephone service. She has had her business for more than seven years and it has gone well for her. 

This loan is to buy potato chips, tostitos, sodas, water, energizer drinks and more. She has been in the credit group for 6 years already and she likes it because of the help the loans give.  

Her goals are to have her own house and locale, since she rents.

loans.use: to buy potato chips, tostitos, sodas, water, energizer drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana, age 46, is involved in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is a dedicated mother of seven. 

She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 31, is a married woman. She has been running a business of hand embroidery for many years. Through her work she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more material such as spools of threads along with packs of sequins, stones and pearls. But because she has a low stock of cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She is hopeful of being able to cater to more customers time after time. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads along with packs of sequins, stones and pearls.

loans.name: La Fortuna  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Fortuna se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, este es un grupo formado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres que hace tiempo atrás vienen recibiendo los créditos los mismos que les han ayudado mucho para mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida, la mayoría se dedica al comercio informal.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Ángela, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  de  7 y 4 años y el menor de solo 6 meses de nacido, el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Ángela al igual que su marido también se dedica al comercio informal, mientras él se desplaza a otras ciudades ella se dedica a recorrer por su zona y parte de la ciudad vendiendo sabanas, edredones, toldos, toallas entre otras cosas, su esposo también vende lo mismo pero en otras ciudades, es así como ellos pueden salir adelante trabajando los dos ya que la situación económica es muy dura y ellos hacen lo posible para que sus hijos tengan un mejor porvenir, ella además de salir a recorrer también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como sabanas, edredones, toldos, toallas entre otras cosas que venden ella y su marido. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño  es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La foto pequeña es de un socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank LA FORTUNA meets every 15 days in the Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for being a very commercial place.  The group is comprised of nine women and two men who have been receiving loans which have greatly improved their business and quality of life.  Most of them are informal merchants.

One of the members of the group is Ángela, 33, who is married and has three children, ages 7, 4 and just six months.  The eldest goes to school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Ángela also works as a merchant and, while her husband travels to other cities, she stays in her area selling sheets, comforters, window shades, towels, etc.  Her husband sells the same things but in other cities.  This is how the two of them earn an income in a difficult economic situation so they can do all they can for their children's future.  She also sells from home when she receives the visit of some of her better-known customers.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as sheets, comforters, window shades, towels to be sold by Ángela and her husband.  This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank which she likes because of how helpful the loans are.

Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

The small photo is of one of the members who could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy sheets, comforters, window shades, towels, etc.

loans.name: Shubana

texts.en:
Shubana is a 40-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the last seven years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to stitch more dresses on time to generate more income. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Clemence operates a food-making business, making fried potatoes which she sells to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase food items like potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items like potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nazeera

texts.en:
Nazeera is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to cover all household expenses she initiated her business of milk sales with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en:
Sevada is 30 years old, and he lives with his family in Kapan City. He has graduated from the Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute Mining and Metallurgical Department. Now he works as an engineer at the Mining and Processing Plant. Sevada is married and he has a daughter and a son. His wife also works at the power plants. Since the money that Sevada and his wife earn is hardly enough for their family's everyday use, there are still many things that they need for their house.

Sevada asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy some equipment for their home. They are sure that the support from Kiva lenders will bring great happiness to their children, since they want very much to have a new TV, a computer and etc.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for their home.

loans.name: Ruita

texts.en:
Ruita is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ruita operates a food-making business, making fried potatoes and chips. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase potatoes and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and materials such as electrodes, keys, lubricants, cables, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary, 35, is from Ndunyu Njeru, married to Regina and they have three children aged nine, six and three years old.

He has been in the farming business for the past three years and is also a milk vendor. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd and intends to use the loan amount to buy a cow. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy more cows so as to increase his livestock.

In the near future, he hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet Ltd to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 31, is a married woman and a mother of six. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Razia requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Oosha

texts.en:
Oosha is a 33-year-old married woman. She has four children. Her husband is a government employee with a low salary income. It was very tough for Oosha to manage her household needs with her husband's small income. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business of cloth trading as she buys cloth of different verities from the wholesale market and then sells them in her area. She is now playing a very important role for her family.

In order to inflate her sales, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase more variety of cloth in different colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es: El G.S Milagro de Dios  está conformado por tres integrantes Norma Elena, Neftalí del Carmen y Miriam de los ángeles,  residentes de uno de los municipios de  Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país zona que se caracteriza por ser comercial productiva, Estos integrantes  se conocen muy bien porque son de la misma zona motivo por el cual deciden formar un Grupo Solidario para apoyarse uno a los otros económicamente e invertir en sus negocios que consiste en la venta de mercadearía en general como: ropa de vestir, ropa interior, chinelas, bisutería, Norma Elena es la responsable del grupo y se encarga de el cumplimiento de los pagos en tiempo y forma de cada uno de ellos, Norma se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería como: ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos entre otros, de forma ambulante negocio que tiene desde hace varios años uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar su negocio y  satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Este financiamiento lo quiere para surtir su pequeño negocio ya que su demanda ha ido creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Milagro de Dios" is comprised of three members: Norma Elena, Neftalí del Carmen and Miriam de los Ángeles.  They reside in the town of Chinandega in the western part of the country which is known for its productive commerce.  These women know each other very well because they are from the same area and decided to form the group to support each other economically to invest in their businesses.  They sell general merchandise such as clothing, underwear, slippers, and costume jewelry.

Norma Elena is the director of the group and she is in charge of all the members meeting their loan repayment deadlines.  Norma sells merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic products and other items.  She has worked as a street vendor for several years.  One of her goals is to increase her business and satisfy customer demand.  This loan will help stock her small business because demand has been increasing.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in general such as clothing, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 30 years old from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Jane and blessed with two children aged eight and five years old.

He has a transport business which he has operated for the past six years and has applied for third loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy a motor bike. With anticipated profit, he plans to start a cosmetics business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motor bike.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila, age 30, is a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is a 45-year-old married woman with six children. For many years, she has been working on hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele, allowing her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishments. This will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is hoping to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 51-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children. Her husband is the main income source of the family. For the past 20 years, Mona has worked as a farmer to increase her family’s revenue. She specializes in cultivating vegetables on her own land.

Mona is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase fertilizer, seeds and plants, and to till her land to prepare it for a good and easy cultivation. She states that her loan will certainly help to increase her business productivity by a large percentage which will return to her as higher profits. In the future, Mona plans to open a vegetable shop and start selling her own harvested goods.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, seeds and plants, and to till her land

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is a 22-year-old farmer; he is married. He completed high school and after that got his diploma with high grades at a technical institution. Now he is working at his farm growing palm trees and selling dates. 

In the evenings, he is also studying machinery and equipment engineering. Every year he faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover college fees and books. With this loan, now he can accommodate all these expenses and plans to use his engineering skills to upgrade his farm through the use of better technology.
